boardgame.name: Mortum: Die Zuflucht
Mortum: Medieval Detective – The Shelter
Мортум: Убежище
boardgame.description:
The Shelter is a separate, stand-alone scenario for Mortum. Medieval Detective.

It is a game of deduction and adventures, which takes place in a grim world shaped in the image of medieval Europe, with its legends, superstitions and fears coming to life. Take on the roles of secret organization agents and investigate mysterious and thrilling events. In this stand-alone scenario you will end up in a sinister place marked by mysterious events. While unraveling its secrets, you will meet people of uneasy fate, none of which are faceless "observers". And some of your actions will determine their destiny. Only you and the choices you make decide how the events will unfold in the end. Tread carefully, and welcome to the Shelter!

During each turn, a player chooses one of the cards available this turn. These cards can represent a Clue, a Location, Witness Interrogation, etc. Using the cards and Special Action, which were received during investigation, a player discovers what actually happened.

We recommend to proceed to this scenario after you finished the core storyline of Mortum. Medieval Detective.

However, you may also play this as a stand-alone scenario, without even having the core game and knowing its plot.

boardgame.name: The Barricade
boardgame.description:
Take turns building the barricade to keep the zombies at bay!

In this abstract dexterity game, you take on the roles of a group of survivors trying to escape a zombie apocalypse.

To keep the zombies at bay, each player needs to help build up the barricade with random pieces carefully stacked on each other. However, at times a player must also remove a part of the barricade to salvage parts for fixing the escape car.

The die adds luck to the situation which can land a player in the dreaded "blind stacking" event where they must depend on the other players' directions/clues to blindly place a barricade piece without toppling it all over. It only takes a handful of mistakes for the players to lose so keep a steady hand and focused mind. The barricade must not fall!

A game turn is comprised of 3 phases:

Barricade Phase - roll the red D6 Action die & consult the Action table (add zombies or add to the barricade)
Car Phase - roll the red D6 Action die & consult the Action table (add zombies or remove from the barricade)
End Phase - zombie check & increase the black D8 Hour die


Players loose if there are 10 zombies at the barricade.
Players win if the D8 Hour die value exceeds 8.

boardgame.name: Dictator of Sweden
boardgame.description:
Dictator of Sweden is played with two teams, representing democrats and anti-democrats, in the Swedish parliament.

Each player is secretly assigned a role in one of the teams, including 1 role as dictator. The ones assigned as anti-democrats will know each other.

Players in turn, will become prime minister, that suggests another player to form government with. If approved by a majority, that government, may take an authoritarian or democratic decision.

The game ends when 6 authoritarian or 6 democratic decisions have been taken.

boardgame.name: Bat Flip
boardgame.description:
Bat Flip is a gamer’s love-letter to baseball. The game features eight original teams, each built around its own distinct baseball strategy or theme. Flex your financial muscles as the New York Moneybags. Bunt and steal your way to victory as the Sioux City Small Ballers. Deliver take-out slides and headhunting pitches as the Detroit Dirt Bags.

Bat Flip is a fast-paced card game of action and reaction. Step into the role of manager, decide how to deploy your players to hit, pitch and field over the course of an action-packed 3-inning game. Respond instantly to your opponent's moves. Utilize your best players and abilities in the most pivotal moments of the game. When the time is just right, swing for the fences and flip that bat.

Similar to the popular game Smash Up, you will draft two team-decks and shuffle them together to form a 24-card deck that combines both team’s players and special abilities.

The game alternates between the At-Bat Step and the Steal Step. During the At-Bat Step, managers will play player cards out of their hand in an attempt to hit safely or draw a walk. In response, the defending manager may play a defender out of their hand in an attempt to mitigate the damage or record an out. When players hit or walk, their cards move around the bases. During the Steal Step, the batting team may attempt to use their Runners' speed to take extra bases and the defense may, again, respond with a defender in attempt to throw the runner out.

Whichever team has the most runs after 3 innings, is the winner!

boardgame.name: Suroboruos
boardgame.description:
Suroborous is an auction game in which the items you bid on will be worth points only if you bid the amounts shown on these items in future auctions — that is, a card may be worth 10 points, but it will show two circles on it, say 30 and 50. The card will not be worth 10 points unless you bid 30 and 50 in future auctions.

The economy is relatively closed with winning bids going to the auctioneer, and the auctioneer's bids going to the bank; however, if any player bids an amount shown on the card up for auction, that card receives a coin from the bank, covering that number.

When the game ends, players earn points for their completed cards, purple cards with special scoring criteria, star symbols on cards, and a bit for leftover money. Of note, players without at least one star symbol are eliminated. Otherwise, the player with the most points wins.

boardgame.name: Bohnanza 25v Juhlapainos
Bohnanza: 25 Aniversario
Bohnanza: 25 Jahre-Edition
Bohnanza: 25th Anniversary Edition
Boonanza: 25 Jaar Jubileum Editie
보난자 25주년
boardgame.description:
In Bohnanza, you plant, then harvest bean cards in order to earn coins. Each player starts with a hand of random bean cards, and each card has a number on it corresponding to the number of that type of beans in the deck. Unlike in most other cards games, you can't rearrange the order of cards in hand, so you must use them in the order that you've picked them up from the deck — unless you can trade them to other players, which is the heart of the game.

On a turn, you must plant the first one or two cards in your hand into the "fields" in front of you. Each field can hold only one type of bean, so if you must plant a type of bean that's not in one of your fields, then you must harvest a field to make room for the new arrival. This usually isn't good! Next, you reveal two cards from the deck, and you can then trade these cards as well as any card in your hand for cards from other players. You can even make future promises for cards received right now! After all the trading is complete — and all trades on a turn must involve the active player — then you end your turn by drawing cards from the deck and placing them at the back of your hand.

When you harvest beans, you receive coins based on the number of bean cards in that field and the "beanometer" for that particular type of bean. Flip over 1-4 cards from that field to transform them into coins, then place the remainder of the cards in the discard pile. When the deck runs out, shuffle the discards, playing through the deck two more times. At the end of the game, everyone can harvest their fields, then whoever has earned the most coins wins.

Bohnanza: 25 Jahre-Edition is a special 25th anniversary edition of the game that contains a new bean type ("Elsterbohne"; magpie bean) and comes with three variant games, one of which will use a collectible coin packaged in the box.

boardgame.name: Artefacts of Power
boardgame.description:
From Publisher:

Artefacts of Power

Realmgates crackle with eldritch energy, incredible artefacts of untold power alter the fates of thousands, and great warriors wielding realmstone-infused arms hunt Endless Spells that strike terror wherever they roam. The Mortal Realms are full of incredible artefacts of power, will you claim them for yourselves?

Warhammer Age of Sigmar Soulbound: Artefacts of Power is perfect for those who want to fill their Soulbound games with incredible magical items, adventures about fate-defining artefacts, and terrifying arcane manifestations unlike anything seen before.

Artefacts of Power contains:

Detailed information about realmstone — crystallised magic energy that can be used to craft powerful weapons, armour, and more.
A vast selection of magical weapons, armour, and artefacts, along with methods of randomly generating your own — with thousands of possible combinations!
A collection of Ancient Relics — artefacts so powerful they can change the fate of the realms. Each of which comes with their own thrilling adventure.
Detailed information on the mysterious distance spanning Realmgates, including ways to create and add them to your games.
Rules, player options, and statblocks for hunting Endless Spells — some of the most deadly creatures in the Mortal Realms.

boardgame.name: Pluto Attacks! Playmat
boardgame.description:
An add-on for the game Pluto Attacks!

Easily keep track of how many cards are out, keep everything organized as you play and the nifty artwork looks pretty cool when you have it to play Pluto Attacks! on.

boardgame.name: Bad Day At Duck Rock
boardgame.description:
From the front cover:

"A murdered thane, an abducted merchant, and an ancient legend. Will the adventurers solve the mystery of Duck Rock".

boardgame.name: The God Skin & Mad Prax
boardgame.description:
User Summary:

Two scenarios in the Sandheart series of adventures.

The first, The God Skin Incident, involves the Sandheart militia following a group of Aldryami who have murdered a headman and stolen a magical item. However its retrieval involves a number of difficult moral choices as to who to side with.

The second, Mad Prax: Beyond Sun Dome, involves the militia come to the aid of a Yelmalion Templar fighting a chaos creature and escort her to the Sun Dome Temple for healing. There they get involved making a delivery to the forces at Harpoon.

boardgame.name: Hegemony: Lead Your Class to Victory – Historical Events
Historische Ereignisse
boardgame.description:
Dive deep into the history of the world in Hegemony! Be at the forefront of the French, American, or Russian Revolution, experience the politico-economic effects of World War I and II, navigate your nation through the Global Financial Crisis, and much more with Historical Events Mode!

The Historical Events deck consists of 40 unique, new cards that will add historical flavor to your games!
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Hegemony: Lead Your Class to Victory

boardgame.name: The Rifter (Issue 85 - Annual 2021)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Rifter® – your favorite portal to the Palladium Books® Megaverse® – is back! And oh boy, do we have a treat for you – 224 pages of the best content from an entire year's worth of submissions. This 2021 annual issue has content for use with almost all our game lines including Rifts®, Palladium Fantasy RPG®, Dead Reign®, Nightbane®, Heroes Unlimited™, and more.

Highlights include:
Soul in Flames: A Rifts® adventure by Barry Wright that captured our imagination so much we put it on the cover!
The Colony of Gonarn: Sweeping location and adventure material for the Palladium Fantasy RPG® by Glen Evans.
Vehicle Encounter Tables: An awesome resource by Lloyd Blair for Dead Reign®, but also eminently useful for Systems Failure®, Chaos Earth®, Beyond the Supernatural™, and even Rifts®.
Beyond Midnight: Inspired by Boxed Nightmares, this combination of story, creature feature, and plot hooks by Dan Frederick includes adventure seeds for nine Palladium settings.
The Redeemer: What does evil-turned-good look like? This O.C.C. by Kyle Osterberg for Nightbane® covers just that.
Magical Collectibles: An array of unique arcane items by Christian Bonawandt for use with any Palladium setting.
The Glitter Boy Revisited: Two articles by Will Erwin that will have Game Masters and players alike taking a fresh new look at everyone's favorite chrome power suit.
Relics of Empire: New setting, history, and source material for Palladium Fantasy RPG® by Ian Herbert.
Plus: Short stories, news, coming attractions, product descriptions, and more.

boardgame.name: Dr. Proteus' Forbidden Files
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Enopugh of the croakings of doom and belittling of genius in those threat assessments the Lightning League has produced. Now get the information straight from the expert -Doctor Proteus, Predator of Cities. Retired mad scientist or lateral thinker? His brilliance is undisputed. This book contains his views and rules for five scientific experiments, which went very wrong. read about the rampage of the Atomic Creature. Thrill to the exploits of the King of Darkness, and plumb the mysteries of the Anomalous Area of the Moon!

boardgame.name: Privateers and Gentlemen
boardgame.description:
Privateers and Gentlemen is a boxed role-playing game set in the late 18th century during the days of Admiral Horatio Nelson and C.S. Forrester's fictional Captain Horatio Hornblower, sometimes called the "Age of Fighting Sail." Players take the roles of naval officers. The boxed set also includes a naval miniatures rulebook that was sold separately.

The game components are:


Promotions and Prizes, a 32-page booklet about the roleplaying system rules
Tradition of Victory, a 32-page booklet containing historical background for the period
A 6-page cardstock referee screen with reference charts
A blank character sheet that could be photocopied
Heart of Oak, a 48-page booklet containing 40 pages of rules for miniatures combat and 8 pages of tables and ship cut-outs (also published separately by Fantasy Games Unlimited).


Click here to see the Privateers and Gentlemen RPG entry on RPG Geek.
boardgame.boardgamecompilation: Heart of Oak: Naval Miniatures Rules for the Age of Fighting Sail

boardgame.name: The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim - The Adventure Game: Gold Septim Tokens
boardgame.description: A set of (25) 25mm diameter metal gold Septim tokens to upgrade your game. Comes with coin bag.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim – The Adventure Game

boardgame.name: Grube Ryby
Wise Guys
boardgame.description:
Wise Guys is a quick-to-learn, cutthroat, area-control board game in which you play as one of four rival gangs seeking to strike it rich as "Rum Runners" on the rough streets of Chicago at the height of the roaring 20s.

Each turn, players wheel, deal, talk, and fight to control locations where they buy and sell alcohol, help politicians get elected, and get help in return or double-cross rival gangs. Negotiate, threaten, and ally with rival gangs when it serves your needs, but be wary of the inevitable knife in the back...

Over six rounds, players take turns driving to locations in the city represented by the grid of cards at the center of the board. Different locations provide access to materials, cash, or clout that the player's gang members can "acquire" through trade, earning profit from property within their territory or by exploiting parts of the city under the control of a rival gang. All players must maintain a certain discretion as selling too much in one round will draw unwanted attention or else saturate the city in liquor — and your fellow mafioso won't be too happy about lost profits.

The gang with the most cash at the end of the game wins.
boardgame.boardgameimplementation: Sons of Anarchy: Men of Mayhem

Title: Wise Guys Publisher: Gale Force Nine Language(s): English

boardgame.name: Invasion: Solo Adventure
boardgame.description:
Aliens have descended into the earth’s atmosphere and seek to conquer its inhabitants. Armies around the world are sending out their personnel, weapons and ammunition in order to combat this invasion. Your military division is ready to receive instructions. You have to rely on a network of civilian and military communication to locate the UFOs. Time is of the essence and you must speed to the last spotted location, hopefully with enough ammunition to either shoot them down out of the sky or hunt the down aliens that are on the loose! THE FATE OF THE EARTH IS IN YOUR HANDS!

Inspired by Jon Meitling's Palm Island, Invasion is the hand held solo game where you try to shoot down the UFOs and then hunt down any surviving aliens. Rotate and store cards to increase your military’s ammunition, speed and efficiency. When you have enough, you can shoot down an UFO or hunt down a an alien. The further you progress, the more likely that UFOs or aliens will appear.

With “ON THE FLY” embedded variant technology, you can increase the challenge of the game or simply add variety to the game without having to add any cards. The variants are found in the top right corner. As head of a military division, your goal is to shoot down as many UFOs and hunt down as many aliens as possible At the end of the game, you will tally your score by the icons in the top left corner.

boardgame.name: Hip Town
boardgame.description:
Start with a blank canvas. Then fill your streetscape with niche businesses of your choice, from craft pickleries to modern speakeasies. Will you construct a culinary empire? A nightlife epicenter? Or something else entirely, marked with your own brand of wit and wisdom? Over 100 unique businesses and a wide variety of game-changing “reality” cards.

On their turn a player rolls a custom die, taking the resulting action. Then they may build a property if they have one that is valid based on the size of their neighborhood.

Once any player has 10 properties, the end of the game is triggered and the person with the most Hip Points and Destination bonuses wins.

boardgame.name: Versus: The Gleaners vs Paris Street – Rainy Day
boardgame.description:
A game with a fast paced mechanic based on puzzling in which players try to put in his/her turn as many pieces of his/her painting in an area delimited by a frame.

Each player has a different puzzle but one condition is always true: they both has the same cutting pattern. As there is not enough space for all the pieces of inside the frame, on his turn a player try to put as many pieces as he/she can in order to contribute the most to the whole puzzle, which will result a hybrid of both images.

The game ends when the frame is completed. The winner is the player who has put more pieces inside the frame.

boardgame.name: Key Enigma: Calling card
boardgame.description:
Calling Card is an escape game that mixes puzzles, narrative, and technology to immerse you. A box full of mysteries and enigmas. With the materials, codes, and clues hidden inside, you must use your ingenuity and match the objects to solve the case.

In this new adventure, you will have to put all your deductive and investigative skills to the test because what seemed like an average case has become a twisted game.

Your role will be to stop and unmask the terrible plans of a distinguished psychopath master of manipulation and specialist in the deepest and darkest instincts that guide the actions of the human being. Who is behind all this?

Puzzles in which you will have to consult and review the different clues and inconsistencies between the suspects, investigate old cases, compare different publications or objects and find the necessary evidence to solve the crimes committed... or prevent them from being committed.

If we manage to reach certain stretch goals, we can add more complex, sophisticated puzzles, which could include magnets, embarking on missions in the real world, receiving phone calls, and higher quality components to get a more realistic and stunning experience, among other amazing surprises.

listing.notes: Multilanguage Version - German, English, Spain, French

boardgame.name: Rory's Story Cubes: My Neighbor Totoro
となりのトトロ ローリーズストーリーキューブス
boardgame.description: Create new stories featuring the characters from the animated film "My Neighbor Totoro" using a new set of 9 dice. Roll the dice and let your imagination wander.

boardgame.name: World of Tanks: Battlegrounds
boardgame.description:
World of Tanks: Battlegrounds - All the elements of the board game have been designed and produced with utmost precision, reflecting the computer game's world in an extremely realistic manner. This makes all the battles on the table nothing short of those that rage in the virtual reality. In both cases, the game is based on three common elements: locations, tanks and tactical battle. The board gameplay is made even more realistic thanks to the pictures of tanks and locations being identical to those in the “World of Tanks” computer game.

The game offers four gameplay options:

basic (battle) – uncovered memory type – on their way to victory, players conquer locations and fight tank battles between each other;
team – for pairs (this option can be played by two or four players);
family – covered memory type – players move through the board with their tanks, looking for location pairs;
solo – a race between the game and the player to conquer more locations.

boardgame.name: Explorers - The Game
boardgame.description:
User Summary

App version of the board game Explorers designed by Phil Walker-Harding.

boardgame.name: Eye of Zamrock: Invasion
boardgame.description:
This is a semi co-op Tower Defense Kingdom Building Economy and Theme based Strategy Boardgame with a large world map, massive card decks, miniatures, modified dice rolling and lore driven.

Fight off the invasion and be the one Kingdom to gain the most EOZ Medals as a recognition of your deeds and lead the world into a new era of prosperity!

Command your Kingdom where you build up your city, armies, equip your Hero through quests, and expand with your Emissary and fight Demon forces who have built a Portal in the iris of the world to destroy everything.

Demons win if any of the Kingdoms fail to build their Crystal Tower to level three by the end of the 24th Turn of play. If the Tower is built, demon Portal closes and a celebratory Tournament is held.

Kingdom with the most EOZ Medals, in the end, wins the game.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: The Dragon's Hoard (Issue #12 - Nov 2021)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Magic, Monsters, and More!
The Dragon’s Hoard is a monthly anthology of magic items, spells, monsters, and more for your 5th Edition campaign! Each issue of The Dragon’s Hoard takes every new magic item, spell, monster, or other new rules content from our ongoing Legendary Loot Patreon and presents it for you, with dozens of new elements beautifully illustrated and ready to unleash on your players! In this month's features you'll find:
• The Treasure Trove, featuring magnificent magic items like the ghost shackles, wand of burning flames, element pharaoh's crook, and sword string violin!
• Basker’s Books, featuring new spells for almost every 5E spellcaster like frost spiral, horrific doubles, boneshaker, and bloodbath!
• Class Acts, featuring new class options for your 5E heroes like the new ballistic barbarian, relic medium, and the spirit tamer!
• Marvelous Monsters, featuring killer creatures across every challenge level like the devastating living crematory, the fear some dullahan, and the murderous bloodthirsty manikin!

boardgame.name: NPCs Collection 18
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Your players' characters will run into many people during the course of a gaming session. Some will be less than memorable, and some will die at the hands of the party, or other NPCs. But some interactions call for more than a name and job title.

DRP NPC Collections feature four different character descriptions, along with their portraits. Use them as-is, flesh them out, or use just the description or the portrait. Don't be caught off guard when your players say, "We want to talk with this character!"

This system-agnostic collection includes:

Kartha'dhunas - male dragonborn paladin
Smells The Wind - male tigerfolk wizard
Bavdak Thriceblessed - male orc wizard
Jinuul Flameblood - female infernal fighter

boardgame.name: Affliction Ascendant
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The battle for Tora Armis ends here.

Deep beneath the hive spire of Tora Armis, the Absolvers Space Marine chapter dispatches a squad of Primaris battle-brothers to finally purge all traces of Chaos. They know they’re chasing the Chaos Lord Putradyne Corporis, but breaching an ancient tomb reveals a still mightier foe: the Great Unclean One Botuthrax Clostidia, newly released from its prison beneath the spire. Faced with three objectives — stopping Corporis, conclusively defeating a millennia-old foe, and saving Tora Armis — the Agents must decide what they’ll sacrifice in the name of duty.

As well as the challenging conclusion to the Battlefield Adventures, Affliction Ascendant includes a new character Archetype; the First Company Veteran represents the most capable and experienced of Space Marines, those with the right to don mighty Terminator armour.

boardgame.name: Gamemasterclass
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In demand like never before, a good gamemaster is a valuable asset. As more and more people try running their own games, many are discovering that it’s not as easy as it looks.

Increasingly, roleplaying games are moving from the mechanical battle simulators of old and becoming more like shared, social stories. Tabletop gaming today (whether online or in-person) involves much more than stat-blocks and rule modifiers. The best gamemasters must have a deft grasp of the social dynamics at play, an understanding of what each player seeks from the experience, and the organisation and flexibility to ensure that everyone has a good time – including themselves!

In this book, veteran gamemaster Chris Cunliffe shares decades of insight into how to run games excellently. From how to resolve player disputes to how to create a beguiling world; from creating a memorable villain to managing improvisation – we cover everything the rules books don’t tell you.

Designed with beginner and intermediate gamemasters in mind, Gamemasterclass aims to help you elevate your games, keep your players spellbound, and (most importantly) ensure that you, too, have a good time.

boardgame.name: Kraken Reef
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Your time in Pearl Bay has been restful and just want you needed after months of adventuring. As you sip a drink, you begin to get that itch for adventuring and ponder your options. Rumors swirl in the large city including a shipwreck survivor with an interesting tale...

Although set in the Margou Campaign, this adventure setting is easily adaptable to most any game and system. This scenario was created for five, sixth level adventurers.

boardgame.name: Social Insecurity
boardgame.description:
The objective of the game is to bank £1000 of your money as you try to overcome the many problems of life on benefits, getting a job and then hanging on to it!

On your turn, you will roll a 6-sided spot dice and then move your elected character piece around the board in a clockwise direction.

Each time you land or pass the Pay Day square, you will receive either your benefit or pay (if you have acquired a job during play) from the designated Banker.

After each throw of the die, the player will turn to the corresponding Flip Chart page heading and then roll the 20-sided spot die. The number showing will then be the number of the instruction to follow on the Flip Chart.
e.g. Player lands on the Pink Elephant square, turn to PUBS chart and roll a 20-sided spot die, lets say it’s number 7, then follow the number 7 instruction.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Ihr Herz schlug Schlager
boardgame.description:
State of emergency in Schlagerland! Everyone who was anyone in the industry had come together for the new edition of the "Schlager-Megaparade".

But shortly before the recording began, singer Janine Bayer was found dead. She was supposed to present her new No. 1 hit "Ich träum von mir heut Nacht" that evening.


Story



State of emergency in Schlagerland! Everyone who was anyone in the industry had come together for the new edition of the "Schlager-Megaparade". The Christmas edition of Germany's most successful TV entertainment show was to be recorded in midsummer of all times. For it neither costs nor efforts were spared! Presenter and pop star Michael Prinz would again present a mix of well-known stars and promising newcomers. The show with snow cannons and a skating reindeer ballet should not only provide for Christmas mood in the living rooms of the spectators, but also strongly boost the record sales of the performing artists.

The recording began punctually at 6:30 p.m. in the sold-out Magdeburg Stadthalle. All the artists were eagerly awaiting their turn. But shortly after the show began, a shrill scream echoed through the hall: a production assistant had found the artist Janine Bayer dead in her dressing room. The singer, who had won the industry award "Der Goldene Gockel" a few weeks ago, was supposed to present her new No. 1 hit "Ich träum von mir heut Nacht" that evening.

Of course, you immediately called an ambulance and the police. But the emergency services that were called in could only determine Janine's death. Apparently, the victim was beaten to death with her own prize statue. While you now wait for your interrogation, you are left on your own with the question: What happened that day? How could this hit fest end so tragically?


Players



4 female and 3 male roles (with 7 people). Male roles can be played by women and vice versa.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Series: Murder Mystery Games (Culinario Mortale Inc.)

boardgame.name: Unsung Heroes
boardgame.description:
This is a game of misfits trying their best to fight the King Rat and become immortalized in Song. Game play is simple, but not simplex, and offers depth of play to the experienced, and accessibility to the beginners. It is a great family game, and full of dry humor.

Unsung Heroes is a resource management game that is unmatched in its class. It comes with more dice than a game has any right to have and is perfect for game night or to pull non gamers into the world of board games. Remember, even the mightiest of adventurers began with only hopes and dreams. Unsung Heroes is the classic 'leveling from 1 to 2' story.

Designed by lifelong nerds looking for good games to play with their non nerd family and friends, Unsung Heroes is quick to learn, yet enjoyable to play. The basic premise is simple: roll dice and play cards to earn points. Highest score gets the rat. Yet the game is deep enough to keep even the most ardent board gamers entertained.

This easy to learn family and adult board game can be played with 2 to 4 players. The average playtime is 30 minutes.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Dragon Prince: Battlecharged Dark Callum Action Deck
boardgame.description: What if Callum had given in to the temptation of dark magic? This special deck explores how he might have been corrupted. Use it with your Callum miniature and experience unique game mechanics that allow you to play cards from Callum's discard pile.

listing.notes:
Comes from a non-smoking home. __________________________________________________
Thank you for considering my promo!
Buyers are responsible for shipping; all shipping is done from 38821.
All payment will be done through Paypal using Friends and Family. Also, because of the post office losing an increased number of packages, I will no longer ship without tracking. For international buyers, this means you will have to pay for customs which will provide a tracking number but will NOT provide insurance.
For US buyers, most promo cards will ship for $4 to the continental US. This will include a tracking number, but not insurance. Insurance will add an additional $5-$6 dollars. For International buyers, most promo cards will ship for between$15-$20. This will include a tracking number, but not insurance. Insurance will add between $20-$40. Note there are some countries that will currently cost more so an exact quote can be provided upon request.
For US buyers, most board games will ship for between $8-$15. This will include a tracking number and insurance. Extremely large packages may cost more. For International buyers, most board games will cost $50 or MORE to ship internationally. This will include a tracking number and insurance. Shipping board games internationally is not recommended.
If you have any questions, feel free to message me.
Thank you once again and have a great day!

boardgame.name: The Winter King
boardgame.description: The Winter King is a variant of the Command & Colors system for fighting battles of the Late Renaissance, focusing primarily on the late 16th to the mid-17th Century. This includes the French Wars of Religion, the Dutch Revolt, the 30 Years War, and the English Civil War. Other conflict areas within this time period (say the 1560s through the 1650’s) should also play well with this system, but earlier conflicts (such as the Italian Wars) or later ones will be less and less representative the farther away from these dates you get.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Chronicles of Frost: Kickstarter Edition
boardgame.description:
This entry is for the Kickstarter edition with additional content in the box. Limited content consists of 18 cards:
- 8 More Fate cards, numbered "LFS01"-"LFS08".
- 4 More Item cards, numbered "LIS01"-"LIS04".
- 5 More World Event cards, numbered "LWR01"-"LWR05".
- 1 More Ally cards, numbered "LAB01".

The land of Valskyrr needs its heroes once again! Only those with true skill and resolve can brave the ever changing icy paths and monstrosities spawned by the nefarious power of the Mists. Fell mighty enemies, explore and shape the land, embark on quests, write your own chronicle, and become a legend in a world of dark sorcery and peril. Will you answer the call to adventure?

Chronicles of Frost is a deck-building adventure game set in Æstemyr, a dark fantasy universe rich in its own lore, shared by Mistfall, Heart of the Mists and Shadowscape.

Start with two unique quests and a small deck, and improve your character by gaining new ability cards, items and allies. Unlock each card's more powerful effect by using skill tokens or by exerting your character to push ever further on your way to becoming a legend. Face ruthless enemies and reap the rewards of your victories. Explore and build the world, creating a new map every time you play, and use the special abilities of locations to your benefit. Manage your deck by retiring cards into your personal chronicle, where they will yield more fame at the end of the game.

Face up to three opponents in a new competitive adventure game (or brave the frozen wilds cooperatively), playable in 80 minutes, and write the chronicle of your hero.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Chronicles of Frost: All That Burns

boardgame.name: Strange in the Neighborhood
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Ghostly Expansion for Stranger Stuff for TinyD6!

When a bump in the night is more than just “the wind,” when you’re sure you “saw something” out of the corner of your eye, or when you just had a long “heart-to-heart” with a dead loved one — who are you going to call?

Strange in the Neighborhood is a game where mad science combines with mystical metaphysics to take on occult terror to hopefully win the day, often while hilarity and hijinks ensue. The players take on the role of paranormal investigators from a wide swath of both mystical occult traditions as well as fringe mad pseudoscience disciplines just trying to get through the day while doing what they love (or at least what they’re capable of).

Strange in the Neighborhood is a ghostly expansion for Stranger Stuff, but easily adaptable to any TinyD6 game. This expansion includes rules for playing various types of paranormal investigators that are looking to find, catalog, study, and/or banish ghosts, spooks, and all manner of spirits, haunts, and supernatural threats. As an expansion, this book does NOT include all the rules needed to play the game — you will need the book Stranger Stuff for TinyD6 to run a game of Strange in the Neighborhood.

boardgame.name: Back to School
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome Back To School, Circa 1984...

Summer is in the past and it’s the early days for your intrepid Kids as they face down the greatest danger yet — a new school year. Included in this book are over a dozen adventure hooks, ideas for threats and challenges for a Gamemaster to flesh out themselves fully to have their Kids take on. These hooks are more than “the usual problems of coming back to school like standing up to bullies, getting their homework done, and finding a date to the big dance; Gamemasters will find stranger ideas included here like immortal history teachers, monsters living in the walls of the school, wondering what IS the “mystery meat” the lunch lady is serving, and much more!

boardgame.name: NPCs Collection 19
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Your players' characters will run into many people during the course of a gaming session. Some will be less than memorable, and some will die at the hands of the party, or other NPCs. But some interactions call for more than a name and job title.

DRP NPC Collections feature four different character descriptions, along with their portraits. Use them as-is, flesh them out, or use just the description or the portrait. Don't be caught off guard when your players say, "We want to talk with this character!"

This system-agnostic collection includes:

Duskprowl - female catfolk cleric
Skyzx Sunrunner - female lizardfolk cleric
Arglarg Batface - male orc fighter
Stoatbane - male owlfolk fighter

boardgame.name: RPG Maps Zine Issue 1: Town Centre Buildings
RPG Maps Zine Issue One: Town Centre Buildings
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This publication brings you 10 highlly detailed hand drawn building maps that could appear in a market square or down a high street in a handy Zine format.

Each building has:

1) A black and white map drawn by Dark Realm Maps cartographer Toby Lancaster – these highly detailed maps are unique and full of items and furniture helping the DM imagine the space as if they are there.

2) A key for the rooms - quick reference list of the rooms.

3) Descriptions for each space – Room descriptors designed for the DM to read out and handy for setting the scene and understanding the space.

4) A plot hook – a short narrative that could be used as a plot, one shot or adventure idea.

5) Roleplay elements embedded – Building names and drawing details that indicate narrative.

They are designed to be used in a range of RPG fantasy settings and with any number of roleplay systems. As a generic set of buildings, they draw upon a selection of references including historical and fantasy settings, such as medieval Europe and Middle Earth. You can inject these into any mission either as the main encounter space or an aside. These town buildings are great for crime style adventures or the launch into something grander, or a way of introducing an NPC.

boardgame.name: Achroma
boardgame.description:
Achroma is a fantasy card game for two or more players. Battle to shape the future of the Five Realms where the ravages of a dark energy called Achrom is spreading, diminishing the magical life force known as Chroma.

During a game of Achroma, you'll spend shards – the life energy that sustains you – to deploy and battle with heroic characters, equip them with objects of power, harness vital locations and unleash cunning actions. Doing so will enable you to gain, drain and steal shards in return. To win, gather 30 shards in your bank or reduce your opponents' banks to 0.

Each Achroma release is centred around an immersive story setting somewhere in the Five Realms. Explore the narrative through new Achroma cards to collect, trade and play with, alongside short stories, music and other media.

The free Achroma app is the ultimate digital companion. It features:
• An interactive, customisable Shard Bank counter.
• Host & join local game sessions – Gain, Drain and Steal with ease.
• Easily access up-to-date game rules.
• Convenient turn summary.
• Add Achroma cards to your account.
• Unlock rewards.
• Earn achievements.
• View your Achrometer.
• Influence the future of Achroma.

boardgame.name: YIMBY
boardgame.description:
Yes In My Backyard!

Work against your fellow real estate developers to make the city of Stockholm into a dense and tall version of its present state. Influence politics and policy to your advantage, increase population density by building crammed housing, close city airports and parks and, for all that’s holy, make sure the nightclubs are in your areas!

Each turn you play one card from your hand, either a scoring card which is secretly discarded or put aside to influence final scoring, or an event card which ads new action spaces to the map or has immediate effects. Then you can activate action spaces on the map, move your pawn, develop new real estate projects (adding cubes to the map), take loans and finally you draw cards up to your variable hand limit.

boardgame.name: MONSTRYS
boardgame.description:
Monstrys is a family card game from 6 years old, of the genre "push your luck" tempts luck, from 2 to 5 players with games between 10 and 15. minutes

Los fastidiosos Monstrys han invadido el Barrio y aparecen en cualquier casa para hacer sus gamberradas. Por suerte, tu y tus amigos estáis dispuestos a darles caza y habéis formado la pandilla "Cazamonstrys" Prepara tu linterna y tu intuición para enfrentarte a estos divertidos invasores
Monstrys es un juego de cartas familiar a partir de 6 años, del genero "push your luck" tienta a la suerte, de 2 a 5 jugadores con partidas entre 10 y 15. minutos

boardgame.name: Frozen Whispers
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Something in Xorvintroth is harming your allies at the Harper safe house. If you can’t find and stop it, your mission will be over before you ever take the fight to the Red Wizards.

Part Two of the The Cold Dark series of adventures.

A four hour adventure for 11th through 16th level characters.

Optimized for: APL 13
boardgame.rpgseries: DDAL - Dreams of the Red Wizards

boardgame.name: Dragons Down
boardgame.description:
Dragons Down is inspired by the classic board game, Magic Realm.

I thought they were crazy, rebuilding civilization on the exact place where the dragons had come down from the sky. Even if it had been over 200 years, everyone knows a dragon's lifetime can be far longer than that. Yet, here I am like all the other fools. Driven by my thirst for fame and to fill my satchel with coin, I arrived in the village at the same time as the other adventurers...

Dragons Down is an adventure game set in Western fantasy where players act as adventurers seeking fame and glory seeking hidden treasure sites, looting great treasures and epic artifacts, fighting monsters... and perhaps each other, all while attempting to become a legend.

Each turn, players can hide from monsters and other players, move around the realm, search for treasure sites and hidden paths, loot found treasure sites, stay alert for trouble, prepare magic, enchant the realm, and/or rest from their wounds. By slaying monsters, looting epic treasures, completing quests, or even hunting down your fellow adventurers, players accumulate fame and fortune. Although a winner is crowned for collecting the most fame and retiring (or dying), the game is a very large sandbox that can be played with your own goals in mind.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Zombie Bus: Les motards
boardgame.description:
Bikers turn around the bus! They count as 2 zombie cards around the bus.

After 3 wounds received (all of the right column or all of the left column), the card becomes only 1 zombie card.

When the back of this card is visible on the zombie pile, the sound of the engines frightens the active player's zombies: the active player recovers all his dice rolls for this turn.

Note: once the bikers are eliminated, discard this card. This card does not earn points.

Les motards tournoient autour du bus ! Ils comptent comme 2 cartes zombies autour du bus.

Après 3 blessures reçues (totalité de la colonne de droite ou totalité de la colonne de gauche), la carte ne plus que comme 1 carte zombie.

Lorsque le dos de cette carte est visible sur la pile de zombies, le bruit des moteurs effraye les zombies du joueur actif : le joueur actif récupère pour ce tour tous ses lancés de dés.

Note : une fois les motards éliminés, défaussez cette carte. Cette carte ne rapporte pas de point.

boardgame.name: Zombie Bus: L'infirmière
boardgame.description:
Immediately place the "Antidote" equipment on the nurse if it is not already in play.

On her arrival, the nurse immediately removes all the zombie wounds present around the bus.

Then at the start of each turn, she eliminates the wounds of the most injured zombie around the bus (player's choice).

The player who eliminates the nurse gets the Antidote.

Posez immédiatement l'équipement "Antidote" sur l'infirmière si celui-ci n'est pas déjà en jeu.

A son arrivée, l'infirmière élimine immédiatement toutes les pastilles blessures des zombies présents autour du bus.

Puis à chaque début de tour, elle élimine les pastilles blessures du zombie le plus bléssé autour du bus (au choix du joueur).

Le joueur qui élimine l'infirmière récupère l'Antidote.

boardgame.name: Retrograde
boardgame.description:
Retrograde is a real-time roll-and-write inspired by classic 80s arcade games.

Evil Astrodroids are invading earth. Grab the joystick and blast as many as you can. Can you get the high score?

Each round, roll your dice as fast as you can. Race to roll combos shown on the target cards, claim the best card, and spend your dice to put the ‘Droids on your sheet out of commission. Be fast, or an opponent might beat you to the card you want. If you're the last player without a card, you can only reroll 2 more times before you're stuck with what you rolled.

Depending on the card you choose, you'll collect Coins and power-ups. Blast entire columns of 'Droids to destroy bosses for bonus points. Blast rows of 'Droids to unlock the power-ups you collect.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Rote Ernte
Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Red Harvest
boardgame.description:
In the Chaos-tainted wastes of the Eightpoints, a bitter struggle rages for control of varanite – a mysterious substance that renders all manner of dark designs possible. Vast hordes of the stuff are dredged up from the depths via daemonic mining machinery that hungers for blood. In these places of infernal industry, warbands devoted to the Ruinous Powers fight to claim great hauls of varanite, using the environment itself as a weapon to annihilate their rivals and claim victory.

Warcry is a game of skirmish-scale battles with larger-than-life action and strategy. Set in the brutal environment of the Eightpoints, rival warbands fight not for survival but for glory and the attention of cruel warlords. The Red Harvest boxed set gives you everything you need to start playing the game of fast-paced warband combat in the Mortal Realms. With a strong focus on narrative gameplay, you’ll create your own warband that vies for territory, wealth, and notoriety. Over time, your fighters will grow, earning new skills and picking up the battle scars to show they’re willing to risk it all. Red Harvest sheds light on the grim existence of those who labour for their dark masters, putting their lives on the line for the merest chance at success and throwing their rivals into the gaping maw of defeat if it means they’ll improve their own situation.

This loaded boxed set contains:

104-page Red Harvest book – laying out the setting of the Eightpoints and varanite delves, the rules of the game, plus enough campaigns and quests to keep you playing for ages
Darkoath Savagers – 10 brutal warriors that value strength above all else and revel in bloodshed. The warband includes 1x Slaughtermaster, 1x God-speaker, 1x Wrathtouched, 2x Proven, and 5x Gloryseekers with a variety of weapon options
Tarantulos Brood – 13 spider-like mutants who worship the Eightfold Watcher. The warband includes 1x Broodmaster, 2x Doomweavers, 7x Broodkin, and 3x Spider Swarms
A 28-piece set of plastic varanite delve scenery – including a centrepiece pit dredger and varanite syphon, 2x wooden structures, 2x ladders, 2x wooden gangways, 12x modular sluice segments, 6x spiked barricades, and 2x spiked gangways
A double-sided 22" x 30" folding gaming board
Tokens, dice, cards, and all the essential accessories you need to play!


Whether you’re taking your first fledgling steps into the inhospitable Eightpoints or seeking new territory for your warband to conquer, Red Harvest is a great way to play Warcry.

—description form the publisher
boardgame.boardgameintegration: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry Starter Set
Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Catacombs
