Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Thunderstrike Stormcast Eternals
Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Tome of Champions 2021
boardgame.boardgameintegration: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry Starter Set
boardgame.boardgameimplementation: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry Starter Set
boardgame.boardgameintegration: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Catacombs
boardgame.boardgameimplementation: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Catacombs

listing.notes:
Warcry Red Harvest - New/Sealed.
Free Shipping.
Miniatures and terrain assembled but never played. Includes Corvus Cabal and Splintered Fang warbands. Buyer pays shipping but it will not exceed $25. Local pickup available in IL.

boardgame.name: Jin-Kei Trick
Tooth & Claw - Animals with Civilization -
Tooth & Claw: Animals with Civilization
狼禽戦線 -文明を持った動物たち-
boardgame.description:
Jin-Kei Trick is a two-player battle card game from Japan. Players arrange the troop cards dealt to them into optimal battle formations, then engage in a battle. After three rounds of seven battles, the player with the highest score wins.

This game incorporates the factor "Jin-Kei" (formation) in a novel way. As cards are played into tricks, other cards move up in the formation. Games can be played quickly, letting players try a variety of tactics as they try to win.

The first edition is played using standard playing cards, while the second edition uses customized cards.

publisher's summary

Jin-Kei Trick は2人専用の対戦カードゲームです。
配られた兵士カードを自分が最適と思う陣形に配置し戦闘を行います。
３ラウンド、各7回行われる戦闘でより多くの点数を獲得したプレイヤーが勝利します。

”Jin-Kei” (陣形) という新しい要素を活かした新しいプレイ感のゲーム。

(初版は Playing Card で遊ぶゲームですが、近い将来専用デッキのバージョンを発表する予定です)
boardgame.boardgameartist: Doubutsu Bunmeishi Kenkyuukai (動物文明史研究会)

boardgame.name: Clifford the Big Red Dog: Pick-Up-Bones Game
boardgame.description: One player grabs all the bones in one hand and drops them on the table. Players take turns removing bones as long as they don’t move any other bones. Most points after all the bones are taken win.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Books: Clifford the Big Red Dog

boardgame.name: Black Forest
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

This is an Incursion for Trophy Dark by Jesse Ross and Hedgemaze Press and Gauntlet Publishing.

In order to play this incursion (adventure) you need the game Trophy Dark.

Content warnings are: body horror, graphic violence, witchcraft, murder, pvp, misogyny, identity crisis, reincarnation, delusions, psychological horror, memory loss

Possible additions are: harm to wild animals, femicide, cannibalism (conditions), harm to teenagers

The Theme is Witchcraft

In this village near the Black Forest, hardly anything is what it appears to be. A quiet, calm town full of self proclaimed god-fearing people with many questions never to be asked and easy solutions for every problem there is. A culture rich with tales of witches and devil, demons and ghosts. A darkness that neither leaves this forest nor the village and the false hope of a good life found in treasure. Trust no one, believe nothing.

The lives of the treasure hunters have been miserable until each of them met a woman a couple of years ago. Those women brought joy and hope back into their lives but also luck and wealth. Shortly after, those peoples reputation and renown within the community increased and now they are the people who get asked for advice but the women haven't been seen again.

Once more things have changed, once more and these people need to go into the forest to keep their secrets hidden.

boardgame.name: Vincent Time Pairs
boardgame.description: Younger players will play by simply collecting the different sets of cards. An additional challenge for the genuine Van Gogh experts is to match the paintings to their periods.

boardgame.name: Flowers Alphabet Rummy
boardgame.description: Rummy with letters and pictures of flowers.

boardgame.name: Super Robot Wars - International Era
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to the world of Super Robot Wars! Some time ago, people decided to make a game series about a whole bunch of mech series that people know and love crossing over, with things like Mazinger Z fighting the Zaku’s of Zeon; and people loved it! Now, it’s one of the most popular game series ever made, in Japan at least. This jump shall focus on the International Era of games.

boardgame.name: Forerunner Shipgirl Chain
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

When people think of the Forerunners, they think of their great technical marvels. They think of their feats of engineering and galaxy spanning empire consisting of three million different worlds. They mourn and respect the final sacrifice this species made to contain an abomination that sought to consume everything. Some that know them better may think of their great hypocrisies and holier-than-thou attitude. I used to be one of those people. Lord, I wish I was still one of those people.

boardgame.name: The New Marvel-Phile (Issue 54)
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

For our Halloween issue, Andrew Goldstein wrote up something especially disturbing... the Hellspawn!!! Featuring the offspring of some of the Marvel Universe's most terrifying infernal beings, plus an additional character type for players to choose from. We hope you enjoy!

boardgame.name: Sorry!: Pets Behaving Badly
boardgame.description:
It's a twist on classic Sorry! gameplay with a hilarious pet theme. In the Sorry! Pets Behaving Badly game players move around the board as the furry or feathered troublemakers who have trashed the house. It's a race to be the first to hide before the human gets home, but watch out for the poops! It's an unpredictable game of strategy, chance, and luck as players chase, race, jump, bump, slide -- and more -- to score. Be the first player to get all 4 pawns to home base to win. This family board game is a great choice for Family Game Night and makes a great gift for pet lovers and kids ages 6 and up.


DON'T GET BUSTED: The pets have done it again! They've trashed the house and they race to hide before they get in trouble. Players move around the board trying to be the first to get to the hiding place




OOPS CARDS AND POOP TOKENS: The game features classic Sorry! moves like jump, bump, and slide. It also includes Poop Tokens and Oops cards that can change a player's luck in an instant




CHALLENGING AND EXCITING GAME: The fun Sorry! game you grew up playing now has a pet theme. It's a challenging game of strategy, chance, and luck...mixed in with some oops and poops


—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: World of Warcraft: Wrath of the Lich King – Brann Bronzebart
World of Warcraft: Wrath of the Lich King – Brann Bronzebeard
World of Warcraft: Wrath of the Lich King – Brann Miedziobrody
World of Warcraft: Wrath of the Lich King – 브란 브론즈비어드
boardgame.description:
A promo hero included by some retailers with the purchase of the World of Warcraft: Wrath of the Lich King board game. Includes hero card and miniature.

Brann Bronzebeard's 2 special abilities:
Look What I've Found!: As an action you can move any other hero in your region, directly on your space.
Renowned Explorer: You can reroll a die when you take the quest action.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: World of Warcraft: Wrath of the Lich King

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

listing.notes: New in shrink. Shipping is 7 euros. English version.

boardgame.name: Battletech: Salvage Box – Shilone Fighter
boardgame.description:
A secret product, developed as a surprise reward for our Kickstarter campaign backers, the Shilone Fighter miniature has been heralded as a great success and a beautiful first entry for our potential aerospace line of miniatures.

Each Salvage Box contains a single Shilone aerospace fighter, an Alpha Strike card, and a pilot card.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: Athanasia
boardgame.description:
Athanasia is a Scifi/Fantasy Competitive Skirmish Wargame where players engage in tactical conflict to secure the key to immortality.

Players mobilize and strategically position their characters, leverage their surroundings to increase their power, and battle their rivals as they venture towards victory.

Every character has a value that determines their health, movement, defense, and attack power as well as additional character abilities that increase their effectiveness on the battlefield.

Each turn, a player is allotted 3 activation points for their civilization which they can use in a variety of ways to increase their own power as well as decrease their rival's power as they carve their path towards victory.

In a given turn a player may: Move their characters across the battlefield based on their allowed movement, collect and activate items that spawn dynamically, activate obelisks to increase their movement, defense, and attack power, activate character abilities to weaken their rivals, and attack or steal items from adjacent rivals using a D20 die to simulate battle. As in any battle, strength in numbers always helps you come out on top. When attacking or defending from rivals, you get additional D20 roll or defense bonuses by positionally linking your characters together.

Securing the key to immortality first requires crafting it at the crafting table in the center of the battlefield using both the philosopher's stone and antimatter which are spawned throughout the game. The race is then on for a civilization to secure the key and activate it at the battlefield's exit point. The player that successfully activates the key at the exit point is the winner. Alternatively, you can win Athanasia by being the sole survivor after obliterating your rivals. Will you be the first to reach immortality?

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Vidrasso
boardgame.description:
In Vidrasso, players go head to head in a tactical trick taker for two. Each player must manage their hand and their strawmen in order to capture high value cards. Rounds begin with a trump suit and trump rank being chosen, giving each player their own edge.

A variety of unique features and speedy gameplay will have players returning to Vidrasso time and time again.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Organizations: The Game Artisans of Canada

boardgame.name: Cards Against Humanity: Nerd Bundle
boardgame.description:
The Nerd Bundle comes with six different themed packs you forgot to buy when they came out plus ten all-new cards we desperately crammed in at the last second.

Comes with the Fantasy Pack, Geek Pack, Sci-Fi Pack, World Wide Web Pack, A.I. Pack, and Human Pack.
An unbelievable deal on Cards Against Humanity themed packs!

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamecompilation: Cards Against Humanity: World Wide Web Pack

boardgame.name: Cards Against Humanity: Nasty Bundle
boardgame.description:
The Nasty Bundle is a collection of six themed packs that's too spicy for most stores. Shuffle these into your deck and make everyone uncomfortable the next time you play!

Comes with the Period Pack, Weed Pack, Ass Pack, Saves America Pack, Picture Card Pack 1, and Picture Card Pack 2.
Also includes ten all-new extra-nasty cards we wrote just for you.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamecompilation: Cards Against Humanity: Picture Card Pack 1
Cards Against Humanity: Picture Card Pack 2
Cards Against Humanity: Saves America Pack

boardgame.name: Gobble Monster
boardgame.description:
A hungry Gobble Monster is ready to eat all your toys! Players race to save as many toys as possible before the monster gets angry and swallows them all.

The game is played in real time. Before the game, players randomly distribute 12 toys on the monster's tongue. Toys come in 4 shapes (bear, plane, car, duck) and three colours (red, green, yellow). Then start a randomised timer on the monster.

On their turn, players draw an action card. Then do the action shown on the card (pick a toy of given shape, pick a toy of given colour, grab a toy from other player, move a toy to a different spot on the tongue).

The game ends when the time runs out and the monster attacks. When he strikes, the active player has to hand over the toys they have taken. Player with the most toys wins.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Adventure Dungeon
boardgame.description:
In-Game Instructions

Welcome, courageous one. To join our wise council, thou must pass the test of power. Thou shalt be placed in a 5 level dungeon where thou must retrieve treasures and defeat monsters.

We will give thee 300 hit points of power to begin with. To defeat a monster, thou must useth some or all of thy hit points against the monster's hit points.

If thou useth the same amount of hit points as the monster haseth, thou wilt have a 50% chance of winning. Using twice as much hit points will give thee a 100% chance.

However, thy hit points and score will only increase if thou haseth less than 100% chance of winning.

Thou must haseth at least 1.5 times the monster's hit points to survive an attack if thou doesth not succeed in defeating the monster.

If thou taketh a treasure which haseth a monster beside it, the monster will attacketh thee.

Thou may, if thoust wish, convert some of thy treasure score points into hit points.

When thou haseth finished the level, thou shalt be placed in another level and continue until thou art overcomed or thou hath completed the test.

Then we will inform thee on thy performance and decide whether thou art fit to join our council.

User Summary

A graphic dungeon crawl with five different randomly generated levels of varying terrain and difficulty. To exit a dungeon level you have to find all of the treasures and defeat all of the monsters on the level. You then proceed to the next level of the dungeon. Once you are on level five, that level repeats each time you complete it, except with a new randomly generated layout.

Your overall goal is to score at least 3500 points to become a member of the wise council. The higher you score, the more esteemed a position you will assume -- up to the highest possible ranking: lord of the wise council.

boardgame.name: Lawnarchy
boardgame.description:
Your gardening community "Garden Frenemies Assoc." is selecting the garden of the year!
So manicure your lawns, trim your hedges and convince the jury. And if that is not enough to beat your neighbors… steal their garden gnomes and steam roll over their flower beds!

Over 50 unique illustrations and over 60 cards that all are functionally different! Lawnarchy is a turn-taking riddle game with lots of tactical thinking, changing objectives and interactive back and forth.

Each player owns a garden of 4 starting cards, only a fence separates you to your neighbor's garden. The rules are simple: Each turn you have three options and pick one card, but the possibilities are complex. 1) You convince the jury and pick a jury card from the examination board - these objectives constantly change! 2) You do some gardening, and replace a card with a garden card from the common "garden center" - same as the jury, all garden cards have different requirements! 3) You squabble with your neighbor by picking a squabble card. You can destroy their garden, steal their gnomes, or rearrange their garden. You have to figure out the best move - a wrong one and your neighbor will get ahead!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Modern Havok: Bongolesia
boardgame.description:
Modern Havok: Bongolesia PDF is a scenario book set in a fictional country in Africa created by Michael T. Murphy. Designed for our 15mm modern miniatures line, these rules are a "tongue-in-cheek" way to play African Wars.

The PDF even has 4 starting scenarios with such themes as Arms deals, Disrupting scammers and Ransoms...

Modern Havok: Bongolesia Boxset is a scenario set and a great way to expand your play in the Chain Reaction system by Two Hour Wargames.

boardgame.name: BattleTech: Technical Readout – 3145 Republic of the Sphere
boardgame.description: Technical Readout: 3145 Republic of the Sphere introduces the wave of new battle armor, vehicle, Battlemech, and aerospace units appearing across the Inner Sphere in the Dark Age era. Featuring new and matured technology, and presented in this series of faction-specific PDFs, these combat units will add excitement and variety to any game table.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: Battletech: Technical Readout – 3145 The Clans
boardgame.description: Technical Readout: 3145 The Clans introduces the wave of new battle armor, vehicle, BattleMech, and aerospace units appearing across the Inner Sphere in the Dark Age era. Featuring new and matured technology, and presented in this series of faction-specific PDFs, these combat units will add excitement and variety to any game table. For use with BattleTech, Total Warfare, Tactical Operations, and Strategic Operations.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: TekenNeus
boardgame.description:
Put on the crazy glasses, take a card and draw the words on the board. The only goal for your fellow players is to guess what you draw. Easy, right!
But it is not. because you have to draw with your nose.
Vor every guessed drawing, not only the person with the correct answer, getas a point, but you to.
Hillarous partygame for the whole family.

—description from the publisher (translated)

boardgame.name: Escape Quest El Inicio: La Furia De Ascalon
Jonathan Eaton's Houses of Treasure: Ascalons Fury
boardgame.description:
A group of friends are invited to the village of Dunlewey by Jonathan Eaton. In his childhood he fell into the catacombs of the local church, and it took 4 days before he found his way out.
Jonathan challenges your group to undertake the same adventure, puzzling and searching your way out of the maze.

listing.notes: Title: Escape Quest - Ascalons Fury Basisspel Publisher: Jumbo Language(s): Dutch

boardgame.name: Flip-It
boardgame.description:
User Summary

8x8 Reversi style game for one player against the computer. Choose your color and whether you want to go first and second, and then find out if you are smarter than your TRS-80! You can also ask the computer to recommend a move for you or to confirm whether you have no legal move available.

boardgame.name: Naughty Xmas
boardgame.description:
Santa is about to retire and needs to find a worthy successor. You must distribute as many gifts as possible during Christmas Eve to inherit this prestigious job. But the competition will be tough, as you are just one of many who hope to take his place! During your journey, you may confront a Blocked Chimney, Bad Cold, or Limping Reindeer. Fortunately, you can defend yourself with Bonus cards, such as a Boomerang, Espionage, or Athletic Reindeer.

On your turn, you must make 3 moves from the following 4 choices:

Distribute a Gift (or Bundle) in front of you
Play a Bonus card (for yourself) or a Naughty card (on an opponent)
Draw a card from the deck (hand limit of 5)
Discard a card

You can do the same move multiple times, but you must use all of your 3 available moves. When you draw a card, you might draw a blue Action card like Christmas Truce or Elves on Strike. If you draw an Action card, you'll resolve it immediately and then draw a new card to replace it.

The gift cards each have from 1-4 present icons on them, showing how valuable they are, and they can be bundled with Bundle cards to make them more valuable. Bonus cards will give you positive extra effects, such as Booster, which gives you 2 extra moves on this turn. Naughty cards will hurt your opponents, such as Sabotage, which gives an opponent 2 fewer turns on their next turn.

Each time play passes all the way around the table back to the first player, they flip over the top clock card, revealing the next hour. After you have played all 12 hours, the game is over, and you add up the present icons on all the Gifts, Bundles, and applicable Bonus cards in front of you. Highest number of presents is the winner and becomes the new Santa!

boardgame.name: StoneFire: Game Mat
boardgame.description:
If you are looking for a great way to enhance your experience while playing StoneFire, then the 14" x 24" roll-up neoprene game mat is just what you are looking for.

The mat will really set the mood with its vibrant design and bold lines. Oh, and a lurking allosaurus never hurts.

The mat will also keep all your cards in order, for a cleaner and more organized play.

boardgame.name: Dicetopia: The Big Box
boardgame.description: One big and very fancy storage solution for all Dicetopia products! UV-print and limited edition "from product description on Kickstarter Add On section"

boardgame.name: The Purging of the Crucible
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

The First Dark Legion War has engulfed the entire solar system, with humanity hard-pressed to hold back the swelling tide of Darkness. The endless hordes of the Dark Legion march forth, stretching the Brotherhood and megacorporations to breaking point. During these dark times, desperation and ominous whispers drive some to the brink of Heresy in search for an advantage against the overwhelming Darkness. The search for long-buried secrets leads into a dark abyss.

The Purging of the Crucible is recommended for experienced players. Set during the events of the First Dark Legion War as the power of the sinister ISC branch known as Blackthorne grows, suggestions are provided on how run the adventure in different timelines.

boardgame.name: The Glorious Empire
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

The Glorious Empire is an Aslan splinter state in the Trojan Reach that engages in the forbidden practice of slavery. The Empire has spurned the Aslan custom of ritual warfare, insisting upon violent open war in all conflicts. Their borders have held strong for centuries… until now. Beset by enemies on all sides, the Empire is now collapsing rapidly and has lost one world after another. However, like a wounded and cornered predator, the Empire does not plan to go down without a fight. On worlds liberated by the Hierate, freed human slaves – the hisol’i – struggle to integrate into Aslan society. On the Empire’s remaining worlds, there are billions more waiting to be freed.

This book contains everything needed to run a campaign in this dangerous and volatile region of space including histories, new career paths, world descriptions, new starships, small craft, vehicles, gear, weapons, and animal encounters. Detailed descriptions of Empire mercenary units, slaving ships, enslaved freedom fighters, black marketeers, key Hierate clans, the vaunted Camoranian Starfighters, and more are provided to add depth and colour to any campaign.

The Glorious Empire is a living region that will change dramatically over the course of a campaign. Wars will be fought, worlds will fall, and Travellers will directly influence, take part in, and decide the shape of things to come. This book includes tools and campaign directions for referees and Travellers to take an active part in the events that change an entire region of space right before their very eyes.

boardgame.name: Hyper Light Drifter Tabletop Roleplaying Game
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Drifter is a tabletop roleplaying game where you or a group of your friends tell a story about drifters in a broken world, using resources and occasionally the roll of the dice to see what happens next. Donning the mantle of bold adventurers called drifters, you will delve into overgrown ruins, protect sanctuaries, and discover secrets to build a brighter future. Unlike a video game with pre-established characters and stories, in Drifter you are the creators of the story, making you free to go in any direction and tell the kinds of stories you want to tell.
boardgame.rpg: Hyper Light Drifter Tabletop Roleplaying Game

boardgame.name: Ronin
boardgame.description:
Publisher blurb:

"Ronin is a solo RPG in which the player builds the story of a wandering warrior in search of redemption.

It uses the Yin-Yang dice system. You roll two 6-sided dice."

boardgame.name: Firebase Inferno
boardgame.description:
Firebase Inferno is a 2 player wargame that takes around 1 hour to play, and is an area control, simultaneous card play, jungle combat wargame set in a near-future dystopian world. Players control one of two factions (the Cyto-Command or the Shadow-Force) who they will use to traverse treacherous jungle terrain, collect strategic resources, and construct powerful upgrades to their base that will deliver devastating blows to their opponent.

At the center of the jungle is a key village location that starts the game in control of the Shadow-Force, and is used to obtain powerful advantages and fund a rebellion against the Cyto-Command. During the game, players will fight for control of the village, along with the other 4 unique locations around the board.

Over the course of 6 rounds, players will simultaneously play commander cards from their hand to move units on and around the board, and engage their opponents in combat. At the end of six rounds, players will total their victory points to determine a winner.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Bandits Underground Ruins Outpost
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You want to run a fun and exciting TTRPG session with your friends, but you don't have a map or idea for the adventure.

This battlemap is perfect for all kinds of fantasy RPGs, like Dungeons & Dragons or Pathfinder. Plus, it comes with a unique and detailed adventure prompt, written just for this map!

The Bandits Underground Ruins Outpost map pack contains everything you need in order to play a fun session! All you need are some miniatures, dice and paper!

boardgame.name: Dreadwoods Castle Ruins
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Your players are getting bored with the same old fantasy dungeons and ruins.

Dreadwoods Castle Ruins is a unique battlemap that you can print easily at home or use in virtual tabletop software like Roll20, Fantasy Grounds, or D20PRO to bring new life to your adventures! It comes with a detailed adventure prompt that easily be used in most game systems.

This battlemap offers everything you need to run an exciting session against undead foes or other creatures! Our detailed adventure prompt provides all kinds of hooks for DM creativity, so whether you're running an existing campaign or creating one from scratch, this map will help make your life easier.

boardgame.name: Glacial Ruins of Rimeridge Castle
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You can't wait to play D&D with your friends, but you're looking for something fresh and easy to run.

We created this battlemap and adventure prompt to give you something different - a frozen fortress where the players must contend with not only a horrible monster in their way, but also an environment that is actively trying to kill them. The Castle Rimeridge has been constructed on top of an active glacier which means there are caverns beneath it filled with ice cold water as well as tunnels leading deep into the mountain itself.

Your players will have so much fun exploring every nook and cranny of this map while they try to defeat the monster that lives here.

boardgame.name: Ruins of Blackcrystal Castle
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

It's hard to find good battlemap for your game. Either it looks beautiful but doesn't have good level design, or the scale is wrong.

We've got you covered! This map was designed to encourage tactical and creative play from your party, with a realistic style. It also includes an adventure hook and detailed prompt that ties into this specific dungeon, so you can get right to playing instead of spending time drawing up plans.

With this product map we've put together almost everything you need in order to create an awesome one-shot session around this ruined underground castle. We've also included tons of different versions of the map so that no matter whether you play on VTT or print your maps at home, there will be something that works for you.

boardgame.name: Coastal Castle Ruins
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You need a beautiful, realistic battlemap of a coastal castle for your RPG campaign.

Great news! This map comes with a richly detailed adventure prompt and hook, so that it'll fit right into your world. Simply print out our battlemap, and then read our story prompt as prepare for game night!

Not only do we provide a high quality D&D battlemap for this adventure location, but also a complete storyline which fits perfectly inside this ruined fortress environment. All of this comes together with a realistic map that can be used in your favourite VTT or printed at home - so grab it now!

boardgame.name: Dwarven Brewery
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You’re a busy GM who wants to spend more time with your friends and family.

We know you love D&D, but sometimes it can be hard to find the time for your next session. That’s why Luke and I created this Dwarven Brewery 40x30 D&D battlemap—so you can spend less time preparing and more time playing! This map comes with an adventure prompt written just for it, so all you have to do is print out the battlemap (they come with instructions, if you like you can trial printing a map here), add some encounter stats, and start running the game. It doesn’t get much easier than that!

It’s a realistic brewery with everything you need for a fun session around potent alcohol. Players can even push enemies into vats of brew! With this map, there's hardly any prep required before your players arrive at the table.

boardgame.name: Illegal Sewer Brewery
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Illegal Sewer Brewery

You’re a DM. Your players are thirsty for adventure and you need to keep them entertained.

We know that your players want to explore new places, meet interesting people, and probably kill them (murder hobos). But what if they could do all of those things in the same place? And what if they could drink while doing it?! That’s where this Illegal Sewer Brewery 40x30 D&D battlemap comes in!

This undercity battlemap is perfect for any party looking to make some coin and rickety-wreck things on the black market. It has everything you need—including a bar, an office for tax-free income (and loan-sharkery), as well as multiple levels in the brewery itself so your players can push enemies into vats during encounters!

boardgame.name: Overgrown Underdark Brewery
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Do you want to spend more time with your friends and family, while also playing great D&D sessions in the underdark?

This map is a great way to do that! It features an overgrown underdark brewery, absolutely overrun with tall, glowing mushrooms that seem to have slowly corrupted the area around them with rust. The map also comes with a detailed adventure prompt, written just for it! With this map you can spend less time prepping and more time having fun at the table.

boardgame.name: Ratmen's Poison Sewer Lair
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Ready to slay some ratmen in a quick one-shot?

You’re probably spending hours preparing for your next session and it can be hard to find the time. We know, we’re DMs too! That's why Luke and I created this Ratmens Poison Sewer Lair 40x30 D&D battlemap. It also comes with a detailed adventure prompt that will make it easy to run a great-one shot with!

boardgame.name: Ratmen's Underdark Poison Brewery
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Looking for a new adventure in the underdark?

This Ratmens Underdark Poison Brewery 40x30 D&D battlemap is perfect for a quick one-shot. It comes with an entire adventure prompt written just for it, so you can jump right into the action (give this free adventure prompt a read and see how good they are)!

boardgame.name: Seaside Cavern Brewery
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Looking for a great battlemap for a quick one-shot involving assassination?

This Seaside Cavern Brewery 40x30 D&D battlemap features the king’s own private brewery, and is the perfect place to… remove him. The ship and pier are ready to be fully loaded with goods, while the bar and dining room wait further up the beach. So many opportunities for your players to lace with poison!

boardgame.name: Seaside Town Brewery
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Looking for a seaside brewery map to use in your next D&D session?

This is the perfect battlemap for you! It’s an incredibly detailed and beautiful map of a brewery nestled into cliffs by the ocean. A ship waits docked at a pier to be loaded with goods, while up the beach a classy bar and dining room wait. There is also town further in, behind the cliffs, where the monks who religiously brew alcohol here live. Ready for VTTs and easy home printing. Plus it comes with an adventure prompt written just for this map!

boardgame.name: Desert Battlement Ruins of the Great Maw
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Do you want to throw your players into a combat that’s set in a ruined desert battlement?

This map is perfect for you! It features an abandoned, spiked battlement with a bone-dry canyon as a moat, with a broken drawbridge. Ragged tents are set up within the battlement, while outside, dust blows through stone outcrops. It’s in a secure position, and one which might have once been used to defend against terrible monsters.

boardgame.name: Eldritch Sky City Battlement
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Playing Call of Cthulhu, and looking for a fun way to drive your players mad?

This battlemap features an eldritch horror, chained beneath a floating city. A huge tentacle forms the bridge to the spiked battlements, embedded with glowing crystals. Further down, shifting mists reveal gaping rows of toothy mouths and strange, porous stone.

You will save so much time preparing for your next session with this battlemap. Not only is it already made in a detailed, realistic style, it’s also designed to encourage creative and tactical play from your friends using level design! Trust me, Luke (the GM who made this) didn’t spend all those years playing WoW and reading nerdy articles online for nothing!

boardgame.name: Ruined Eldritch Sky City Battlement
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Looking to drive your players mad, Lovecraft-style?

This battlemap features an eldritch horror, chained beneath a ruined, floating city. Something horrible has happened here, for there are gaping holes blasted in the floors, and the crumbling battlements look all but abandoned. Yet still, a huge tentacle forms the bridge to the spiked fortifications, embedded with shattered crystals.

boardgame.name: Creature Feature Quarterly Volume 9
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

16 new monsters for your OLD SCHOOL ESSENTIALS game.


Extensive Fluff including Descriptions, Lore, Ecology, Adventure Seeds and some ideas for memorable Loot.



Paper Mini designs for EVERY monster! Designed for easy print and play so you can easily get them on your table quick!



VTT tokens for EVERY monster if you prefer to play your oldskool on Roll20, etc.



The PDF is formatted to be easily printed at home on A4 sheets as A5 facing pages.

boardgame.name: Chroni: L'Histoire Des Arts
boardgame.description:
'Chroni' is a card game where each card depicts a historical event, invention or discovery on both sides, with the year in which that event occurred, invention or discovery was made on only one side. Players take turns placing a card from their hand in a row on the table. After placing the card, the player reveals the date on it. If the card was placed correctly with the date in chronological order with all other cards on the table, the card stays in place; otherwise the card is removed from play and the player takes another card from the deck.

The first player to get rid of all his cards by placing them correctly wins. If multiple players go out in the same round, then everyone else is eliminated from play and each of those players are dealt one more card for another round of play. If only one player has no cards after a bonus round, he wins; otherwise play continues until a single player goes out.

boardgame.name: World of Warcraft Trading Card Game: Fires of Outland Booster Pack
boardgame.description:
The third normal World of Warcraft TCG set is named Fires of Outland.

Rush to war as the conflict is joined in Outland! The armies of Azeroth lay siege to the mysterious world, while the Burning Legion throws its might against the Stair of Destiny. Prestige and Glory await those who are bold enough to join the fray. Let your battle cry be heard as echoes of war engulf the blood-soaked world. Will you be prepared?
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: World of Warcraft Trading Card Game

boardgame.name: World of Warcraft Trading Card Game: Heroes of Azeroth Booster Pack
boardgame.description:
The first World of Warcraft TCG set, named Heroes of Azeroth.

Horns blaze across the Eastern Kingdoms, calling the Alliance to arms. The drums of Durotar hasten the Horde to prepare for the looming conflict ahead. Glorious battles, prized treasures and dominion over all of Azeroth are on the table! The time is now; this is your battle.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: World of Warcraft Trading Card Game

boardgame.name: World of Warcraft Trading Card Game: Treasure Chest
boardgame.description: Unlock a treasure with this set of World of Warcraft TCG dice and treasure chest storage container. Each set includes 16 dice: 8x red six-sided dice, 8x blue six-sided dice, and 2x ten-sided dice, perfect for tracking the health of your hero and allies during the game. When you're not playing, store them in the treasure chest, which was molded to look exactly like the chests on the online game!
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: World of Warcraft Trading Card Game

boardgame.name: Hokey Pokey
boardgame.description:
Hokey Pokey is a game where 2 to 4 players play on a table with metal goals at each end. One team is called Hokey and the other Pokey. Object of the game is to push a wooden puck along the table in the direction of a players goal. This is accomplished by using a thick wire with a handle at one end and a wooden disk at the other. The wooden disk slides along the table surface to push the puck along. The first person or team to score 4 goals is the winner. violation of rules such as swiping the puck instead of pushing sees the opposing team calling out their name (i.e Hokey) and receiving a free push.

The game was produced when the Hokey Pokey song and accompanying dance peaked in popularity as a music hall song and novelty dance in the mid-1940s in the UK and Australia.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Battletech: Technical Readout – 3145 Lyran Commonwealth
boardgame.description: Technical Readout: 3145 Lyran Commonwealth introduces the wave of new battle armor, vehicle, BattleMech, and aerospace units appearing across the Inner Sphere in the Dark Age era. Featuring new and matured technology, and presented in this series of faction-specific PDFs, these combat units will add excitement and variety to any game table.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: World of Warcraft Trading Card Game: March of the Legion Booster Pack
boardgame.description:
The fourth normal World of Warcraft TCG set, named March of the Legion.

From his seat upon the Throne of Kil'jaeden, Doom Lord Kazzak raises his sword and calls the fel host to battle. Infernals march from the Deathforge of Shadowmoon Valley to bolster demonic armies across the shattered realm of Outland and to crush all those who stand in their way. The Burning Crusade is upon us. The March of the Legion has begun. Heed the call!
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: World of Warcraft Trading Card Game

boardgame.name: Interplanetary: A giant hop for Squeakind
boardgame.description:
An automata-free solo experience about exploring and settling in one's solar system, with an entirely player-driven gameplay system and very few random elements.

Billions watched the live global broadcast of the first Squeak hopping on the Mun over 50 years ago. Now, the various nations on planet Tree have finally come together as the United Forests and have created a planet-wide space program to peacefully explore their solar system. You have been selected as Head of the Exploratory Branch of that program! Send probes into the void to reach distant moons and comets. Go where no Squeak has gone before and put two adorable little paws on another planet. Design and construct never-before seen spacecraft, purpose-made for your missions in interplanetary space. Peacefully explore the Squeak's solar system and establish research outposts on its many worlds and moons. Maybe, just maybe, make startling discoveries out on the final frontier and herald a new era for all of Squeakind!

This solo-game is an entirely player-driven experience, there are no turns and there is no opponent or random events. This is a Score-and-Reset game, that sees you tackling a "campaign deck" that presents you with a semi-random list of goals you need to achieve, called "directives".
After the initial setup, play consists of you picking an action from a (rather long) list, executing that action and then paying its cost by moving a cube along a numbered track. This cube tracks the available amount of actions to fulfill your current directive.
Each time the cube reaches the end of its track, the campaign deck gets updated and if you take too long, you might have failed your current directive. When the campaign deck runs out, you tally your score and if that score is better than your previous scores, you can rejoice!

In summary, this is a game of heavy action-economy optimization. You are trying to fulfill your goal with the most optimal sequence of actions while trying to improve your overall situation to have a better chance to also tackle the next directive.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Maya Code
boardgame.description:
Fantasy + Strategy = Maya Gold

Conquer the sun platform with wits and logic and occupy it with the code of your own tribal colours. Those eliminated are dropped into the pyramid chamber. The winner obtains the eternal Maya gold. Discover new and fascinating strategies with every round.

Erich von Däniken: "While doing research work for my book 'The day the Gods arrived', I was fascinated by the vast mathematical knowledge of the Maya. Maya Code, a witty game with sparkling possibilities, recreates the way of thinking of the Maya. Intelligent entertainment!"

—description from the back of the box

This is a two-player version of Maya Code. Confusingly, the box shows a picture of the four-player version of the game.

boardgame.name: Mega Man Adventures
boardgame.description:
Mega Man Adventures is a cooperative game for 1-4 players designed by Michael Kelley and Peter Gousis. Based on the classic video game franchise, Mega Man Adventures sees players take on the roles of Mega Man and his allies to battle against the nefarious Dr. Wily and his powerful Robot Masters. There are two main ways to play the game: as a quick single game, or as an ongoing campaign to eventually take on Dr. Wily himself!

Players must plan their turns out by playing Action cards, using one for themselves and two others to support their fellow heroes with bonus abilities as they traverse deadly stages filled with traps, obstacles and enemies. If a single hero loses their last health point, all heroes lose!

Working together, the heroes will eventually each reach a dreaded Robot Master, who makes use of a unique boss pattern the players must decipher if they hope to defeat it and gain its signature weapon—handy when facing other Robot Masters or even Dr. Wily in his castle!

Featuring enemies, stages and Robot Masters from Mega Man 1, Mega Man 2, and Mega Man 3, you can play through campaigns that recreate those titles, or mix and match to create your own customized one! Whether you're a fan of the video games or simply enjoy cooperative games, Mega Man Adventures is a quick-playing, action-packed game for everyone to enjoy!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Street Fighter V: Champion Edition Legends
boardgame.description:
Street Fighter V: Champion Edition - Legends is a cooperative game of brawling action for 1–4 players designed by Mitch Schroeder.

In each game, you will take on the role of your favorite Street Fighter characters and work together to defeat your rivals and overcome your nemesis. Build your combos, upgrade your abilities, and create your legend.

The Four Kings are up to no good and it falls upon the World Warriors to stop them. Choosing a fan-favorite fighter, such as Ryu or Chun-Li, players will perform powerful attacks and build epic combos on their way to defeating the king at the end of each stage. Combining modular style decks and familiar special moves unique to each fighter, there is no shortage of options for toppling the kings, one by one.

Featuring a huge roster of characters and stages from Street Fighter V: Champion Edition in an all-new cooperative setting, players will be able to experience Street Fighter like never before.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Gone with the Beans
Mame to tomoni are
豆と共にあれ
boardgame.description:
Gone with the Beans (豆と共にあれ) is a flip-and-write game in which players take on the role of bean farmers who are acquiring and managing their resources while trying to grow their farm. The game includes fifty copies each of four different game boards, each with different set-ups, although the base system is the same. Players start in different provinces with different special abilities, and on each of of the game's fifteen turns, a character wanders the board, affecting where players can do what. Each turn, players gain some income, then have a number of actions from which to choose, such as building facilities or achieving milestones.

The game is strongly influenced by the author's favorite game, Terra Mystica.

豆と共にあれはフリップ＆ライトゲームです。
プレイヤーは豆農家となり、リソースを管理し、自分の農場を大きくすることを目指します。
ゲームシートが複数種類あり、ベースシステムは同じものの、それぞれ違った仕掛けが施されています。
プレイヤーが使用する国によって特殊能力が違うため、様々な組み合わせで遊ぶことが出来ます。
作者の好きなテラミスティカに強く影響を受けています。
publisher's summary

boardgame.name: Gravetides: A Naval Fantasy Miniature Wargame
boardgame.description:
Gravetides is a naval tactical miniature game of epic sea battles involving two or more fantasy fleets of magical and non-magical warships led by skilled captains and powerful sorcerers and manned by crews of ordinary humans and supernatural creatures.

Warships may face abyssal monsters or come across strange marine phenomenons and mysterious events caused by the wild mystical energies that traverse the drowning world of GRAVETIDES whose nature has been altered forever by the invasion of a magical parasite known as ‘The Defiler’.

Fleets can be supported in battle by small squadrons of winged creatures or flying machines while underwater vessels or sea creatures under the spell of sorcerers can strike at enemies from the deep.

Magic can wreak chaos and mayhem among enemy ranks or backfire unpredictably disrupting carefully laid battle plans.

Players can tailor their battle fleets selecting the number and types of warships, their individual special equipment and the quality and skills of their commanders and crews.

—description from the rulebook

boardgame.name: Microcity: Microville expansion
boardgame.description:
Postcard with map on one side, rules on the other including goal, set up and gameplay.

The card substitutes instead of a building card from base game. You use teh Microville card instead the regular/challenge building. You have to prepare the 4-card city as usual and put Microville next to it. You don't go to Microville with your Engineer, you build Microville with your regular build action. You score points for what you've built and for the sets of 3.

boardgame.name: Löwenzahn: Löwenschlau
boardgame.description:
Quiz game based on Stadt Land Fluss - 55 question cards are placed in a stack with the theme side up, the letter tiles are shuffled face down and laid out. The player on the turn reveals a letter tile and all players simultaneously search for a term matching the card with the revealed initial letter. The first player to name a correct term gets the card, and the letter is removed from the game. If there are only 10 letters left in the middle, the player with the most cards wins.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Löwenzahn: Peters Obstgarten
boardgame.description:
In Peter's orchard, the fruits are ripe and must be harvested. Each player must always have as many fruits in his basket as the open collection cards indicate, the type of fruit doesn't matter, but there must be no unripe fruits. Under the 12 collecting discs hide the most different numbers of pieces. Whoever's turn it is must choose one of the cards and may then turn over 2 unblocked discs - if the number of uncovered fruits is correct, you get the card, the discs are covered and the player moves 2 blocking discs. The player who has harvested 50 fruits wins.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Feeling Sheepish
boardgame.description:
Play cards to manipulate the flock to your advantage. When five or more “sheep” are face up, a player may end the game instead of playing a card. Players score the sheep on their edge of the flock and the high score wins.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Classic Rally
boardgame.description:
The thrills of classic car rallying, from preparing the car and logistics, to the days on the road competing and assisting the car, in order to try to get it to the finish quicker than the others.

Classic Rally is the board game that brings the classic and historic cars world to the tabletop. This game emulates the features, behavior and even problems of real life classic cars. At the same time, it simulates the main features of real life road rallying, like road books, checkpoints, weather changes, hazards, service areas, assistance cars, overtaking other cars on the road, etc.

This is a strategy game with a great component of logistics, just like in a real life car rally. Fuel and tires management play a great part on this game. Properly understanding the road book and going the right way is crucial to succeed in this game, as it is in real life car rallying.

This game has an initial setup phase, where each player contributes to the construction of the board, by tile placing road segments - this makes every game play unique.

Each player manages 2 cars (one competition car and one assistance car), having to select the features of the competition car and what each car will carry. There are dice to influence weather conditions and car malfunctions. There are cards with car features (like sport suspension), car accessories (like fog lights) and consumables (like fuel). The cars are moved by using fuel cards, depending on its feature and accessory cards and influenced by the weather conditions and malfunctions.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Fulanos
boardgame.description:
Walking by the big city, you personify some 'porteños' early 20th century's characters: thief, policeman, 'mina' (woman), 'guapo' (man) or bartender.

The objective of the game is to travel through the city and collect money by avoiding the conflicts that arise when turning the wheel of destiny. The first player to deposit $ 5000.- in the bank, wins the game.

On their turn, players roll a die and move to the nearest square matching the color spot. When landing at a location, they spin the wheel of destiny and deal with the conflict.

boardgame.name: Dizzy Lizzy
boardgame.description:
A dice game combining strategy and luck in a race to the finish first!
—description from the publisher

Players take turns moving their pieces strategically to either land on beneficial spaces or to avoid potential hazards on a maze-like board in a race to see who can get to the finish line first.

—user summary

boardgame.name: El Fantasma
boardgame.description:
Each player must place letters on the board taking advantage of the prize boxes that will grant them credits (1, 2, or 3). The first player to get five credits is the winner. However, You can become a ghost and walk away from your goal or you can object to the last player's turn or call the word as completed - causing other players to lose credits or lives.

Avoid losing your three lives, because you will become the ghost.
Get five points to win the game.

boardgame.name: Hack!
boardgame.description:
In this game Hack!, 4 players try to hack each other's computers to steal private data and secrets, using some routers and USB cables. Each time one of them succeeds, he or she gets smarter and thus stronger. But be aware! When you get too smart, you'll surely meet more hurdles! The first player that manages to hack all computers wins the game.

Players layout a 6x6 grid of tiles face down and start the game with 5 tiles in their hand. Players use or discard tiles from their hand to explore the boards and to turn, manipulate or block the route of networks as the board is developed.

boardgame.name: GrymmWorld
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

"Once upon a time" is a magical moment. The GrymmWorld campaign setting places your characters in a dark fairy tail, with DM alongside them wearing the mask of the enigmatic Narrador. With strong focus on alternate ways to roleplay and interact at your table, GrymmWorld introduces the world of Prometerra, its various denizens, class options, locations, quests, and more...

boardgame.name: Squarin' Off
boardgame.description:
A game based off the old childhood game of Connect-the-Dots, but played with single, double and triple-point squares to enhance a level of strategy Complete as many squares as possible by filling in all four sides of a square with pegs while trying to give your opponents as few squares as possible. The player with the most points (not necessarily the most squares) wins.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Spellcaster: The Frostgrave Magazine #7
boardgame.description:
Spellcaster: The Frostgrave Magazine exists to bring new rules, scenarios, and gaming ideas for players of Frostgrave and Frostgrave: Ghost Archipelago.
This issue contains:

The Diamonds of Elias Skull, a 3-scenario campaign for Ghost Archipelago.
The Maze of Malcor Outtakes, including 1 scenario and 10 weird events.
The Floating Hulk, a solo scenario for Ghost Archipelago.
The Great Wyrm, a Frostgrave ‘big game’ campaign by Brent Sinclair, 3-scenarios leading to an encounter with a dragon!
Rules for a new character, the Archer, in Barbarian Hack.
Casting Roll Criticals in Frostgrave for Second Edition.
16 Ulterior Motive Cards for Ghost Archipelago.


—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Rome: Fall of the Empire
boardgame.description:
Reenact the fall of the Roman Empire in this grand campaign map. Hold the line as the Eastern or Western Roman Empire, supplant the empire with your kingdom as the tribal factions of the Sassanids, Franks and Goths, or trample all before you as the Huns. Each faction has unique victory conditions and ways to play. With numerous paths to victory, including variants, the game offers much replay-ability.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Newton & Great Discoveries
Newton & Grosse Entdeckungen
boardgame.description:
The 2nd Edition includes the Great Discoveries expansion and two promo cards (Stephen Hawking & Robert Hooke).

The middle of the 17th century was a period of great changes; with the advent of the scientific method came what we now call the Scientific Revolution. Many great scientists, with their theories and ideas, changed and shaped our perception of the universe: Galileo Galilei, Copernicus, Kepler, Bacon and, above all, Sir Isaac Newton.

In Newton, the players take the role of a young scientist who wants to become one of the great geniuses of this era. To reach their ultimate goal, they travel around Europe, visit universities and cities, study to discover new theories, build new tools and work to earn money.

The game is played over six rounds. Each round, every player plays five cards from their hand, and each played card allows the player to perform one of the many actions of the game. An action can have a variety of effects, which depend on the symbols on the board. At the end of the round, a player can take back all the cards except for one. One card has to remain on the board, which means that you give up one possibility of doing that action, but also that that very action will be carried out with greater strength. Fortunately, you can acquire new cards with additional powers to perform more actions.

After six rounds, you calculate your final score, and the player with the most VP wins.

—description from the publisher

The game contains a large number of traps to stop you.

Players win if the two are reunited.


Rodinná hra Gump pěkně potrápí vaše mozkové závity a zažijete nezapomenutelná dobrodružství. Při hře se snažíte, aby se psí kamarádi Gump a Bedřich opět setkali. Hra obsahuje velké množství nástrah a úskalí, která budete muset překonat a bude jistě bavit celou rodinu.

boardgame.name: Wipe Out
boardgame.description:
Can you draw a picture of. Scarecrow riding a horse in the jungle? Or a cowboy picking flowers on a pirate ship?

Put your artistic talents to the test with this crazy drawing game! Players battle it out to draw funny scenes based on topic cards for their team to guess. Will you be able to guess the right answer or will you be a doodle dropout?

The team that guesses the most answers, wins!

boardgame.name: Pathfinder Online
boardgame.description:
Pathfinder Online was announced on November 27, 2012 by Goblin Works and Paizo and was successful in attracting Kickstarter crowdfunding in 2013 to finance its development. An official alpha test was announced in late June 2014. On September 2, 2015, Lisa Stevens, acting CEO of Goblinworks and CEO of Paizo Publishing announced layoffs at Goblinworks of most of the Pathfinder Online development team. As of March 2016, the project was in the process of transitioning to a new developer. Completion of development was left uncertain.

On July 27, 2021, it was announced by Goblin Works that they planned to shut the game down permanently on November 28, 2021 after a big finale. They did however, say that it may not be possible for them to keep the servers running the entire time, citing the age of the servers.

boardgame.name: Planet Box
boardgame.description:
Planet Box is a bluffing game from Japan. Players take turns placing numbered pieces into a sliding box. They are trying to bluff how many stars they are putting in. If if it is too many, and their bluff is called, the galaxy bursts and they must take back stars. The first player to clear their pool is the winner.
user summary

Publisher summary:
You are God. You are the Creator God.

This is the "star-stuffing game" played by the gods. You have to fill the mysterious PLANETBOX with stars in order and try to get rid of them before anyone else does. However, the box has a mass limit, and if you overfill it with stars, other players will spot you and penalise you.
It's a simple yet profound bluffing game where the key is to be able to spot when you have too many stars.

あなたは神です。創造神です。
これは神々がたしなむ「星詰めゲーム」。あなたは不思議な箱PLANETBOXに星を順番に入れていき、誰よりも早く手持ちの星を無くすことを目指します。ただ、この箱には質量制限があり、星を詰めすぎると他のプレイヤーに見破られてペナルティを受けてしまうかもしれません。
星の詰めすぎを見破れるかがカギとなるシンプルで奥深いブラフゲームです。
publisher's summary
boardgame.boardgamepublisher: Umeruma Games (ウメルマゲームズ)

boardgame.name: Kamelon
boardgame.description:
Kamelon is a bluffing game from Japan. A baker has stolen the shells from turtles to make Melonpan (a tasty snack that looks like a turtle shell). The turtles sneak around the bakery at night to try and get their shells back. If the baker can catch them, they lose.

Players move their turtles secretly around the tiles, face-down so their backs look like the other bun pieces. Arrows on each tile indicate where they can move too, and the tiles can be rotated. The baker can search when the shop is open, by turning over a bun. If a turtle can get across the shop to get their shell, and back to the exit in time without being found, they win.
user summary

A popular melonpan baker in town. In fact, it is a bad bakery that steals shells from the turtles behind the scenes and traffics them. One day, a turtle breaks into the bakery and steals the shell. But it is already time to open the shop. The only place he can hide is in the huge pile of melon pans! The turtle tries to escape by moving from melon pan to melon pan. But when you move, you give a clue to the shopkeeper. The clerk tries to guess where the turtle is hiding, and the turtle tries to deceive him with a false route.

街で人気のメロンパン屋。実は裏でカメからコウラを奪い、密売する悪いパン屋だった。ある日、コウラを奪われた一匹のカメがパン屋店に侵入。しかしもう店の開店時間だ。隠れられるのは、大量に並んだメロンパンの中のみ！メロンパンからメロンパンへ移動して脱出を目指すカメ。しかし移動は店員にヒントを与えてしまう。ヒントを頼りに隠れ場所を推理する店員と、偽の経路で欺こうとするカメの、頭脳系推理ブラフゲームです。
publisher's summary
boardgame.boardgamepublisher: Umeruma Games (ウメルマゲームズ)

boardgame.name: Attactics
boardgame.description:
It’s a race to the center as you try to evade and eliminate your opponents throughout the maze. Move your pieces via various dice sequences and accumulate points to that help advance your Monarch.

Players start at the corner of the board and attempt to be the first to move their Monarch meeple to the center of the board or eliminate the opponent's Monarchs from the game. Players can capture their opponents' pieces to move their Monarch.

boardgame.name: Submarine Boost Game
boardgame.description:
Submarine Boost Game, a simple roll-and-move game, is a Subway kids meal giveaway. Each player rolls dice to move three submarines along a track, and the first player to get all their subs to the end wins. If a submarine lands on an opponent's submarine, the player gets a second turn.

The game comes with punch-out paper pieces and game board that must be assembled.

boardgame.name: Planet Portfolio 2: Volume 3 - Gas Giants
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This digital product contains a series of 12 high resolution science fiction and space virtual tabletop “gas giant themed” assets. Files are provided printable PDF format that can be cut out for use with physical tabletop starscapes as well as VTT-ready format (600 dpi transparent background PNG graphic files). Volume 2 includes twelve cratered moon variants.

boardgame.name: Planet Portfolio 2: Volume 4 - Suns
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Files are provided printable PDF format that can be cut out for use with physical tabletop starscapes as well as VTT-ready format (600 dpi transparent background PNG graphic files). Volume 2 includes twelve cratered moon variants.

boardgame.name: Planet Portfolio 2: Volume 5 - More Celestial Bodies
Planet Portfolio 2: Volume 5 - Other Celestial Bodies
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This digital product contains a series of 41 high resolution science fiction and space virtual tabletop “asteroid / comet” assets. Files are provided printable PDF format that can be cut out for use with physical tabletop starscapes as well as VTT-ready format (600 dpi transparent background PNG graphic files).

boardgame.name: Nov 12, 2021
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Map Theme: Cliff Trace Ferryman's Hut

Each Free Map Friday ZIP contains five 5100x3300 pixel (600 dpi) high-resolution versions of a single dungeon map. Those versions include:

1. Virtual Tabletop (VTT) Map
2. Player Map (With Grids)
3. Player Map (Without Grids)
4. GM Map

boardgame.name: Nov 19, 2021

Publisher's blurb:

Each Free Map Friday ZIP contains five 5100x3300 pixel (600 dpi) high-resolution versions of a single dungeon map. Those versions include:

1. Virtual Tabletop (VTT) Map
2. Player Map (With Grids)
