boardgame.name: Space Battlefields: Interactive Quantum Radar Map Assets
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This digital product contains 280 digital assets intended to create interactive "Quantum Radar" maps using any virtual tabletop (VTT) platform. The starship assets included are 100% compatible with the Paths To Adventure "Starship Deckplans" series and includes "quantum radar scan" tokens for every starship in all ten volumes.
boardgame.rpgissuearticle: Space Battlefields: Interactive Quantum Radar Map Assets

boardgame.name: Game-a-Saurus Rex
boardgame.description:
Game-A-Saurus Rex is a playful little prehistoric plush! Rex comes stuffed with a soft blanket that doubles as a playmat along with plenty of pieces that can be used to play 10 different games!

Games include: Rock, Paper, Caveman; Egg Hatch Memory; Tic-Rock-Toe; Speedy Peppers; The Great Egg Race; The Dino Run; Egg Basket; The Rex Connect; Dino Fish; and Do You See What I See?

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Modern Day Gladiators: Expansion 3 - Domination
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Against many forecasts, JW had survived the storm that was the first months of his wrestling circuit, or what he thought of as his, even if controlling shares were truly owned by Locke Enterprises. Though it’d been less than a year, he’d established a burgeoning brand built on hard ring work and dynamic personalities. Slowly, he was re-establishing wrestling as an entertainment option in the United States. Slowly, he was proving he’d made the correct decision in undergoing this venture, to his family and to himself.

boardgame.name: Modern Day Gladiators: Expansion 4 - Wrestlegacy
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

He’d survived the first year. So many naysayers had said JW had finally leapt off the deep end, and just like every other risk he’d attempted, he knew they just might be right. But they weren’t. Wrestling had taken enough hits over the last ten years that many did welcome him, more or less, if for no other reason than that he’d infused the industry with some much needed capital. The only question from his doubters now was the same many had started with—

Why bother?

boardgame.name: Medieval (Issue 2 - Q4 2021)
boardgame.description:
Medieval
Regular Issue #2
boardgame.rpgissue: Medieval: Real Medieval Life for RPGs

boardgame.name: Road to Armageddon - Cardboard Characters - NPCs in TW2000
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Apart from the specific NPCs provided in the scen­ar­ios included in the Referee’s manual there is no sys­tem in the Core Rules (either book) to allow for the quick creation of more generic NPCs on the spot.

This monograph provides a much more detailed system with NPCs drawn from a variety of careers and drawn in narrow enough strokes (though with room for cust­om­is­ation) to be quick to flesh out as needed.

These are grouped into Brigand/Partisans, Bandit/Partisans, Conscript Infantry, Regular Infantry, Vet­er­an Infantry, Elite Infantry, Special Forces, Mech­anised Forces, Artillery and Combat Engineers … each different in key ways.

The material presented in this book is a stand alone extract of material included in Road to Armageddon Modern Encounters.

boardgame.name: Road to Armageddon - Category IV Wartime Mobilisation Only Divisions
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Find it hard to believe that the equipment still in use after the nuclear exchange is (maybe worn) first rate pre-war stuff?

The Russians never threw away anything -- or not right away -- and a lot of WW2 and 1950's stuff that had been long out of service even in Category III (Reserve) Divisions was held in storage and was intended to be used to activate follow on units after the Category III ones marched off to the Front.

Thse are (unofficially) Category IV (Wartime Mobilisation Only) Divisions and this is where you can find data listings for the smallarms and vehicles they could reasonably (or even unreasonably) be expected to end up being equipped with -

Nagant Revolvers, Moisin-Nagant Rifles, PPSh and PPS SMGs, SVT Automatic Rifles, DP-27 Light Machineguns and assorted WW2 era Mortars, AA and AT Guns and light Artillery. T-34/85 Tanks, BTR-40 Scout Cars, BTR-152 APCs ... and many more weapons and vehicles

Also included are Lend Lease (and generally non-Soviet) gear such as the M4a4(76)W Sherman, M3/M5 Halftrack, M1928 Thomson SMG, Bren LMG.

Additional rules are provided for those who believe that Tanks should have Turrets treated separately as in previous generations of the rules and modifications for dealing with weaknesses in Obsolete Armour vs Modern Weapons (and Obsolete Weapons vs Modern Armour) and other factors, including more realistic Maintenance Rules, especially for notoriously poorly designed Soviet vehicles.

boardgame.name: Road to Armageddon - The Fourth Horseman - Disease in TW2000
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Core Rules have a limited number of Diseases included – and the way they are presented is far from realistic in practically all respects. Virulence, Incu­bation, Infection Period, Effects are more often wrong than not.

The most likely diseases are not (normally) serious ones – they will be Stomach & Gastrointestinal or Resp­iratory infections (Mild Food Poisoning, Mild Diar­rhoea, Colds and Mild Influenza) and Infected Wounds. These are covered in more detail herein.

Also included are Uncommon & Unlikely Diseases – the more (potentially) lethal ones that might be encounter­ed in Northern and Northwestern Europe – some are only lethal given the damage to established health and medical infrastructure, others were always dang­er­ous and are more so with said collapse. A number of real and imaginary Bio­weapons are also included – really lethal or nasty in other ways.

The included Diseases are best used as Plot Devices … the PCs may have to backtrack around an area suffering from an outbreak of disease, for example, of they may have to find a supply of vaccine.

The material presented in this book is a stand alone extract of material included in Road to Armageddon Modern Encounters.

boardgame.name: Road to Armageddon - Modern Encounters for Twilight 2000
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Dogs of War have been loosed -- the world is fac­ing nuclear and biological Armageddon between com­peting, ruthless, power blocs -- powers aiming at noth­ing less than total victory and the complete destruct­ion of anyone who opposes them.

The struggle between these two Blocs has been going on for years, but has only recently become a Hot war -- the 3WW to the West, the Anti-Imperialist War in the Pact Nations and the New Jihad in the Em­irate ... and it has become a nasty one.

Your campaign will be set against these events and this book provides a comprehensive system for de­scrib­ing game region(s) and is compatible with TW2000 (though it replaces its Encounter System) and determining Encounters that may occur, planned or random.

Encounters are detailed in generic terms and large num­ber of detailed Encounters based on these are also provided -- and these include additional infor­m­at­ion to allow them to be further customised or to create custom encounters of the same general type.

The systems described herein may be used to describe the war affected areas of the world immediately prior to as well as after The Exchange.

boardgame.name: Greyhawk Reborn Players Guide
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to the world of Greyhawk Reborn (GHR). Greyhawk Reborn is an organized play campaign that uses the Dungeons and Dragons 5th Edition ruleset and the Warduke Press Organized Play System to provide a unique, character centered play experience in a shared world where the decisions of the players have direct impact on the events of the story. As a player, everything you need to get started, other than a Player’s Handbook, can be found here.

boardgame.name: Greyhawk Reborn Rebuild Rules
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The Rebuild Rules provide the opportunity to update and adjust characters due to final release of D&D 5E Player's Handbook. Player characters remain true to their original concepts as created in the beginning of their adventuring career. Philosophically, no character may be modified primarily for min-maxing, nor to change its function within the party.

boardgame.name: Greyhawk Reborn Campaign Groups
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Campaign Groups (or CGs) are a way that players and their characters can be a part of a faction in the world of Greyhawk. There are many factions that you could join - organized churches, knighthoods, arcane brotherhoods, thieves’ guilds, and adventuring companies.

boardgame.name: Greyhawk Reborn 2019 Character Conversion Guide
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

In order to convert your existing character to be ready for play in 2019, you will need to follow a few simple steps.

boardgame.name: 15 Minute Heist
boardgame.description:
The players co-operate to empty a vault of gold before the time is up. The laser locks have to strategically be opened and closed according to dice rolls, so the carts can move between the vaults. The elevator also has to be moved up and down several times to get all the gold out. The same dice control both the locks and the elevator, so the most efficient use of the dice has to be quickly chosen upon.

When in turn, a player always rolls the two colour dice. A die can be used to open or close a matching laser lock on the track, or to move the elevator to the next level, if the colour matches. Further, the player can move their own cart along the tracks on their turn. They try to open a way to an opened vault with gold, and move there to load their cart. With a loaded cart they try to move to the elevator console in the middle of the board, and unload the gold off their cart there. When a cart is being moved, it can move freely along any tracks, until its way is blocked.

A free app needs to be downloaded for full play. The app functions as a timer, but also tells the players when their (non-player) partners on street level have managed to open a new vault. Gold can only be fetched from the opened vaults.

The elevator can only take 3 gold pallets at a time, and 12 pallets need to be brought to street level, before the time is up. If the players manage to bring up the 10th-12th pallets before the time is up, they win! If the 15 minutes are up before that, the players lose...

boardgame.name: La llamada de Cthulhu
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:
TU ERES EL HÉROE DE LA AVENTURA: DE TU DECISIÓN DEPENDE TU CORDURA
Corre el invierno de 1926 y funestas noticias sobre el fallecimiento de tu tío-abuelo George Grammell Angel, profesor de la Universidad de Brown, llegan hasta tu puerta.¿En qué siniestros estudios estaba envuelto? ¿Qué diablos es esa espantosa criatura, mitad dragón, mitad pulpo, que aparece en una tablilla entre sus pertenencias? ¿Tendrás el valor de enfrentarte a la secreta existencia de un culto ancestral que rinde pleitesía a seres de pesadilla venidos de los confines del tiempo y el espacio?

boardgame.name: ギリ、義理チョコ(Giri Giri Chocolate)
boardgame.description:
Giri Giri Chocolate is a simple card game. People who got most chocolate will win, but people who got most amount of "Honmei Chocolate" will drop out from the game.

You give present cards to girls of your classmate. You choose a card from your hand and put it on the table, face down. People who shows smallest number start to give it to the girl. They have some restrictions respectively to put your cards.

After you give them gift, you pick up a card from a supply. You continue to doing it 4 times.

When Valentine's Day come, compare your present cards. People who give them most valuable present(biggest number) gains the "Honmei chocolate", and second highest present gains the "Giri Chocolate".

boardgame.name: Der Abenteuer Club
Club des Aventuriers
boardgame.description:
Ever fought a great white shark with an iron and lipstick? Or distracted yourself with a disco ball and chewing gum? No?
The time has come! Welcome to the ADVENTURE CLUB!
Together you will experience hair-raising adventures and master a wide variety of challenges with unusual methods and crazy ideas. “Make the best of it!” is the motto here, as you will only have a random and limited selection of objects in your hand. Ingenuity, logic, and a healthy dose of insanity will lead you to success.

Gameplay:
Everyone gets 10 random cards of objects.
One player reads a chapter out of the “book of adventures” until he reaches a challenge. Now the person next to him must choose exactly 2 cards that he/she thinks are best suited to solving the challenge. The same player also chooses 3 other cards that he/she thinks are the most unsuitable for solving the challenge.
Shuffle those 5 cards face down and reveal them in the middle of the table. (Additionally, the 2 chosen items can be written as a proof on a secret tablet)
Now, all other players need to discuss and find the 2 chosen items.
The game ends after the group successfully solved 5 challenges or failed 3 times during one adventure.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: The Brass Age
boardgame.description:
The Brass Age is a Steam-and-Ætherpunk, bag and tableau building card battle game. Play as one of several Nations from an alternate 1880, and defeat an enemy nation by recruiting, boosting and activating military forces, manipulating and improving your bag of ability tokens, and researching powerful SCIENCE!

Playable Nations include:

The British Imperium, ruled with an iron fist from the industrial nightmare city of True London by the tyrant Emperor Victor.

The Kingdom of America, led by King Abraham the 1st, who survived an assassin's bullet to drive his people to tame the Weird West.

The Martian Invasion Fleet, hungrily seeking the resources of Earth to save their dying civilization.

—description from the publisher

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: PsyCATS
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

It is a little-known fact that one out of every 10,000 house cats manifests mild psychic abilities. Said abilities are generally limited to small tricks like getting humans to open doors, drop food, or forget to turn off their heated blankets. But for one out of every 500,000 cats, greater powers and vast ambitions lie behind their glowing eyes. These self-styled “Phrenical Cats” have developed superior intelligence, powerful psychic abilities, deep ambitions, and strangely enough, musical talent.

PsyCATS is a mini-RPG inspired by over-the-top cat-based musicals, psychic powers, and various indie RPGs. You take on the role of a singing, dancing, psychic-power-wielding cat on the night of the annual Phrenical Ball, where you, your friends, and your rivals have gathered to perform your musical introductions for Admiral Ragamuffler, the leader of the Phrenical Cats. At the end of the night, the Admiral will declare a winner - a winner who will be permitted to psychically enthrall a human of great influence (Royalty? A president? A social media influence? An indie RPG designer? It's up to you!).

But what's this? Admiral Ragamuffler has been kidnapped by one of your rivals! It's up to you and your crew to get them back - using whatever psychic powers you have at your disposal! Balance your Feral and Phrenic natures and declare your intentions through song in this one-shot novelty RPG!

boardgame.name: Memento Vitae
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

You're dead. But you now find yourself at The Last Call, a bar run by Death.

Before you move on, Death wants to hear stories of your life. Whoever most impresses Death will get a second chance at life. Will your tales be intriguing enough?

Memento Vitae is a storytelling game about impressing Death. Each player takes on a character who recently died, and everyone tells stories from their character's life to try to impress Death. Whoever tells the most impressive stories wins.

boardgame.name: Rommel's Last Stand: Italy 1943-44, What If?
boardgame.description:
"Rommel’s Last Stand: Italy 1943-44, What If?" (RLS) is an low-complexity, two-player wargame simulating the possible events that could have unfolded during the first 30 days of this alternative history World War II campaign.

A complete game generally takes two to three hours to complete, and it is suitable for solitaire play. Each hex on the map equals 5 miles (8 km) from side to opposite side. Each full turn represents two weeks to two months, depending on the time of year. Every ground unit represents a regiment, brigade or division of about 2,500 to 12,000 men and/or 50 to 350 armored fighting vehicles.

published in Banzai Magazine No. 11

boardgame.name: A.T.R.A.M
Advanced Tactical Reconnaissance and Attack Mission
boardgame.description: A.T.R.A.M (Advanced Reconnaissance and Attack Mission) is one of the first "Computer Aided Board Games". Players command military forces in a simulated NATO exercise against each other.

Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Battletech: Technical Readout – 3145 Free Worlds League
boardgame.description:
Technical Readout: 3145 Free Worlds League introduces the wave of new battle armor, vehicle, BattleMech, and aerospace units appearing across the Inner Sphere in the Dark Age era. Featuring new and matured technology, and presented in this series of faction-specific PDFs, these combat units will add excitement and variety to any game table.

Each title includes Record Sheets for each featured unit and its variants.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: Battletech: Technical Readout – 3145 Federated Suns
boardgame.description:
Technical Readout: 3145 Federated Suns introduces the wave of new battle armor, vehicle, BattleMech, and aerospace units appearing across the Inner Sphere in the Dark Age era. Featuring new and matured technology, and presented in this series of faction-specific PDFs, these combat units will add excitement and variety to any game table. For use with BattleTech, Total Warfare, Tactical Operations, and Strategic Operations.

Each title includes Record Sheets for each featured unit and its variants.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: AVíO
boardgame.description:
AVíO is a trick-taking game in which you must choose wisely which cards to play, and even more which one to keep, in order to win.

The cards in AVíO, as in other trick-taking games, have a value and a suit. The special feature is that they also contain an objective to be fulfilled (an avio). In each round, players are dealt 9 cards and 8 tricks are played. The card that is not played determines the objective of each player in the round and the points he/she gets if he/she fulfills it.

The first player to score 30 points wins the game.

boardgame.name: Alien Elements
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Unobtanium!

Strange substances that defy the laws of nature are a staple of sci-fi, and your heroes can tap into their mysterious power! Explore over a dozen new class features tied to these eldritch elements with Aetheric Scion alternate class features and Planar Maneuvers like aetheric capacitor, flauros infusion, kinetic revival, and aetheric jaunt!

boardgame.name: Halflings (PF1)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

One of the most iconic creatures found in most high fantasy games, halflings have been part of the game since the beginning. In Sundara, though, they’re more than just hillfolk with a love of quiet life. From the hard-riding shepherds of the Vale to the green-skinned forest recluses of the Suff Folk, and from the cloud-skimming Skycatchers to the seabound Tidelings, halflings in Sundara are anything but typical.

This book contains 5 separate cultures of halflings, complete with the sorts of social groups and environments they tend to fall into, along with notes on languages, a possible origin of the species (as distant cousins to dwarves, for those who believe in myths), as well as providing mechanics to customize your halflings to give this variety a bit of teeth.

As with all previous releases in this setting, Halflings of Sundara is broad enough that you can use it in any of your home games, while also slotting neatly into the growing Sundara: Dawn of a New Age setting for those who want to explore what else this world has to offer!
boardgame.rpgsetting: Sundara: Dawn of a New Age

boardgame.name: Halflings (5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

One of the most iconic creatures found in most high fantasy games, halflings have been part of the game since the beginning. In Sundara, though, they’re more than just hillfolk with a love of quiet life. From the hard-riding shepherds of the Vale to the green-skinned forest recluses of the Suff Folk, and from the cloud-skimming Skycatchers to the seabound Tidelings, halflings in Sundara are anything but typical.

This book contains 5 separate cultures of halflings, complete with the sorts of social groups and environments they tend to fall into, along with notes on languages, a possible origin of the species (as distant cousins to dwarves, for those who believe in myths), as well as providing mechanics to customize your halflings to give this variety a bit of teeth.

As with all previous releases in this setting, Halflings of Sundara is broad enough that you can use it in any of your home games, while also slotting neatly into the growing Sundara: Dawn of a New Age setting for those who want to explore what else this world has to offer!
boardgame.rpgsetting: Sundara: Dawn of a New Age

boardgame.name: Tales from the Trail
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Tales from the Trail is a compendium for THE AFTER containing four adventures. The book itself is 64 pages featuring full colour, detailed and provocative artwork by Jon Gibbons.

Each adventure will vary in tone and playing style, allowing the player characters to fight, explore, investigate and socialize their way through the challenges contained within.

1. Death in the Depths, by Ade Smith

This adventure for Novice characters is a ‘survival horror’ scenario. The player characters enter an abandoned Old World mine in search of useful military salvage, and become trapped after a rival group of explorers sets off a cave-in. A series of event-based encounters ensue as the monstrous creatures in the depths of the mines are awakened. Will your players escape in time from the Death in the Depths?

2. The Right Hand of Nothing, by Sean Nokes and James Thomson

A twisted and deranged cult is rampaging through Wind River Valley! In this adventure for Seasoned heroes, the heroes will strive to rescue innocent townsfolk from the clutches of Reverend Obadiah Blank. Can they defeat the cult before the hostages are transformed into more brainwashed cannibals?

3. The Trials of Ascension, by Ade Smith
Novice characters visit the Hanging Rocks to take part in a Helot tradition: a race to an orbship at the center of the Breach Zone! Groups will be challenged in a series of mental and physical trials, and will need to deal with rival teams in non-lethal ways. This adventure is a great opportunity for GMs to introduce new NPCs, let the player characters make new social connections, and lay the groundwork for future expeditions into the After.

4. The Nightmare Seed, by Ade Smith
It’s no longer safe to go out after dark in the town of Daniel! The Sacellum of Light fears that the
wrath of their God has fallen upon their town... can your heroes discover the truth?

Also includes Zachariah’s Field Guide, which includes several new monsters for The After.

boardgame.name: Caspar's Guide to Elementals
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Caspar's Guide to Elementals is filled to the brim with new races, transformations, classes, and an examination of the Elemental Chaos, who lives there, how much they get along, and how much they deserve to be stabbed in the face and have their diamond palaces looted.

Devastate your foes with the new Elementalist class, with a flexible casting system based on a small number of elemental attacks customizable with a wide variety of elemental metamagic, this is a class easy enough for a new player to grasp without having to grapple with spell slots and dozens of options even for 1st-level spells, but tactically deep enough to satisfy veteran players - including that new player once they’ve got a few sessions under their belt and have figured out how the game works. Become an Arcane Knight, a heavy-armored arcane sub-class for the Fighter that’s actually good. Or follow the Way of Fire, Stone, Ice, or Storm, with any of the four elemental Monk sub-classes which live in harmony until the Fire Nation attacks.

Soar through the air as a harpy or a gargoyle, or embrace the elemental power of the nymphs: Dryads, naiads, oreads, and lampads. Or embrace elemental power on an entirely different scale by bonding with an elemental symbiote and attuning to it as though to a magic item. As you sacrifice more attunement slots to the bond, you will become more and more elemental, until by the end you are entirely made of the element you have bonded with and command its power.

boardgame.name: The Virtual Grimoire
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Virtual Playground for Wizards

The digital world of Infinity's Edge is overflowing with magic of all sorts, and for every kind of magic, there's at least one kind of spellcaster eager to bend it to their will. With the power of the Five Elements and the Ten Energies, there is very little that magic cannot accomplish, and very few forms it cannot take. But such power requires knowledge, and the most effective knowledge comes in the form of essential formulae, what layment might call spells.

The Infinity's Edge Role-Playing Game includes a number of different spells for all ten different types of magic, but that's not enough for dedicated players to make use of. The Virtual Grimoire not only introduces sixty new spells for characters to use in whatever manner they wish, but it takes the original forty spells from the core rulebook and expands them with rules for Upcasting, which allows spells to become more powerful as the characters who possess them do.

boardgame.name: The Soulforge: Spirit of a Hero
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Forge the powers and skills of ancient spirits to your very soul!

The Soulforge: Spirit of a Hero is the latest akashic class published by Studio M—! The soulforge draws its power from the Akashic Record, channeling and forging the armaments and skills of ancient heros and villians of eld in the form of akashic veils and powerful forged souls that grant them a wide range of abilities and armaments that they can change each day!

The soulforge is built to be flexible; able to change its loadout each day to suit whatever needs are required of it. With the ability to change some of its combat feats each day as well as swapping their Strength and Dexterity, they can easily adjust as needed. This combined with their armaments provided by their veilweaving can allow the soulforge unparraelled flexibility as a martial combatent!

By utilizing their forged souls the soulforge can imbue their very essence with the spirits of ancient heros and villians, drawing powers and abilities from Pathfinder's core classes! Channel portions of the unbridled rage of a barbarian, the martial prowess of a fighter, or the arcane talents of a sorcerer! These forged souls also help to expand their access to veils by granting them access to an expanded list of veils!

Don't want to focus on akashic weapons, armor, and shields? The soulforge can take the Soul Exemplar archetype to focus entirely on the power of their forged souls! They get a second soul much faster than the base class, and an increased number of soul veils, as well as some extra flexibility with those veils!

Also included with this book are new magic items, alterations to existing magic items, and 24 new [Enhanced] veils for the soulforge and other akashic classes!

By purchasing this book, you also get The Soulforge: Content Compendium. This 61-page supplement includes reprints of the full rules for veilweaving, a number of akashic feats, as well as every veil on the soulforge's veil list! This book, along with The Soulforge: Spirit of a Hero is everything you need to get started with the akashic magic system!

boardgame.name: Battletech: Technical Readout – 3145 Draconis Combine
boardgame.description:
Technical Readout: 3145 Draconis Combine introduces the wave of new battle armor, vehicle, BattleMech, and aerospace units appearing across the Inner Sphere in the Dark Age era. Featuring new and matured technology, and presented in this series of faction-specific PDFs, these combat units will add excitement and variety to any game table.

Each title includes Record Sheets for each featured unit and its variants.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: Epic Boons: A Sourcebook for 5th Edition
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This sourcebook for the 5th Edition roleplaying game system provides more than 200 new and exciting examples of Epic Boons, including ones that apply to specific classes, heritages, backgrounds, and alignments, as well as a section of some that are especially powerful.

Official Epic Boons tend to be very generic in nature and are clearly intended to be used in vanilla settings or adapted by Storytellers to their own creations and this supplement takes this concept to the next level.

boardgame.name: Moonlight Made Madness
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Bronze Age Britain scenario for investigative weird, occult and horror roleplaying. Compatible with percentile-based Lovecraftian roleplaying games, easily converted to other systems and settings.

The arrival of spring has brought warmth and optimism to Woikós Helémesi, a small community near the great Sehimréys river. The mood is shattered at full moon, when a villager succumbs to a mysterious sickness. Foreboding spirits haunt the land, and those who have learned the hidden tales of old must seek out the truth, in the tangled wilderness where the People do not willingly tread. Something terrible is on the verge of breaking free, and their fragile community faces annihilation. The waning moon shines thinly now, but there is little time before it waxes once more and draws doom upon them.

Content warnings: disease, body horror, infestation

boardgame.name: Orc War Camp
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Monstrous Lair #47: Orc War Camp provides you—the busy, time-crunched GM—with the details to effortlessly bring to life the orc war camps in your campaign. Are you a busy GM? Does session prep take too long? Do you never have time to work on the cool little details that can bring your adventures, dungeons and campaign to life? This short, focused compilation gives you, the time-crunched GM, the tools to effortlessly add verisimilitude and detail to your dungeons. Use the material herein either before or during play and bask in your players' adulation.

boardgame.name: Forgotten Knowledge
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Tomb of Rellannick has been abandoned for decades. Once a holy place, it has fallen into disrepair, and whlie still known throughout the desert, few travel to the tomb. Now, word is circulating that long lost knowledge and relics are hidden at the tomb.

Hidden Knowledge can be used as an adventure in any campaign world, or played as a sandbox in Hellebarde's default setting. Written and tested with Castles and Crusades RPG, notes are provided for conversion to other OSR systems.

Forgotten Knowledge can be used stand-alone or as part of the Exterris Adventure Tome AT-5 (AT-5 plus ONA-17 through ONA-20).

boardgame.name: Sorcerous Origin: Paradox Bloodline
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

An unforeseen consequence of various attempts by other powers to interfere with history, some sorcerers draw their arcane power from causeless effect. These sorcerers may be people whose origins were erased by time travel, or even people wholly displaced from their own time by changes to history. Whatever the case, originating from a sequence of events which defy conventional logic, these sorcerers’ spells may behave in strange or unpredictable ways, interacting with other sources of magic with an unexpected serendipity.

Building off of the existing Fifth Edition rules to build a sorcerer character, the Paradox Bloodline grants sorcerers chronomantic abilities, drawn from exposure to disruptions in time. This PDF also contains new metamagic options for all sorcerers to enhance their spells with some chronomancy flavor.

boardgame.name: Battletech: Technical Readout – 3145 Capellan Confederation
boardgame.description:
Technical Readout: 3145 Capellan Confederation introduces the wave of new battle armor, vehicle, BattleMech, and aerospace units appearing across the Inner Sphere in the Dark Age era. Featuring new and matured technology, and presented in this series of faction-specific PDFs, these combat units will add excitement and variety to any game table.

Each title includes Record Sheets for each featured unit and its variants.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: Woods & Worries
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A group of treants are attacking a local lumber mill, and the workers are in danger of losing their lives and their jobs. But what motivated them to suddenly attack the lumberjacks?

This is a short, system agnostic adventure for any fantasy roleplaying game. It is designed to be played in a single session, or perhaps in a few short sessions. The adventure contains a central plot hook, a series of detailed NPCs featured in the scenario, instructions for setup and establishing the scene, a progression of scenes accompanied by GM guidance, and a conclusion with suggested adventure rewards and plot threads that can be further developed. Maps and other reference material are included to help run the adventure. The document is a printer-friendly black and white, for ease of use in print as well as digitally.

boardgame.name: False Crowns
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A doppelganger has taken the throne. They’ve been impersonating the ruler for a few years now, and their reign has been prosperous. When the shapeshifter confesses what they’ve done, certain members of the royal court conspire to unseat this usurper and restore the old ruler to power.

This is a short, system agnostic adventure for any fantasy roleplaying game. It is designed to be played in a single session, or perhaps in a few short sessions. The adventure contains a central plot hook, a series of detailed NPCs featured in the scenario, instructions for setup and establishing the scene, a progression of scenes accompanied by GM guidance, and a conclusion with suggested adventure rewards and plot threads that can be further developed. Maps and other reference material are included to help run the adventure. The document is a printer-friendly black and white, for ease of use in print as well as digitally.

boardgame.name: Pillars of the Storm
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

When a magical storm passes through the land, the strikes of lightning stand in place rather than fade away in a flash. Scholars and mages try to discern the source of this strange phenomenon, and seek help with removing them before they cause any serious harm.

This is a short, system agnostic adventure for any fantasy roleplaying game. It is designed to be played in a single session, or perhaps in a few short sessions. The adventure contains a central plot hook, a series of detailed NPCs featured in the scenario, instructions for setup and establishing the scene, a progression of scenes accompanied by GM guidance, and a conclusion with suggested adventure rewards and plot threads that can be further developed. Maps and other reference material are included to help run the adventure. The document is a printer-friendly black and white, for ease of use in print as well as digitally.

boardgame.name: Lost Ship from Arthenelos
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Lost Ship from Arthenelos is an adventure about trying to recover a valuable artifact from a ship that disappeared long ago, only to reappear recently under mysterious circumstances. As port officials conduct their investigation about this strange happening, criminal elements plan a heist of the riches that this lost merchant ship was sent to claim.

This is a short, system agnostic adventure for any fantasy roleplaying game. It is designed to be played in a single session, or perhaps in a few short sessions. The adventure contains a central plot hook, a series of detailed NPCs featured in the scenario, instructions for setup and establishing the scene, a progression of scenes accompanied by GM guidance, and a conclusion with suggested adventure rewards and plot threads that can be further developed. Maps and other reference material are included to help run the adventure. The document is a printer-friendly black and white, for ease of use in print as well as digitally.

boardgame.name: Dire Mongooses
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Dire Mongooses is an adventure about dealing with a pack of magically-enhanced wild creatures being used by a reckless wizard to fight against an incursion of serpentfolk. When they slip control of the wizard’s oversight and begin harming a nearby village, several parties wish to see them removed and seek aid in exterminating them.

This is a short, system agnostic adventure for any fantasy roleplaying game. It is designed to be played in a single session, or perhaps in a few short sessions. The adventure contains a central plot hook, a series of detailed NPCs featured in the scenario, instructions for setup and establishing the scene, a progression of scenes accompanied by GM guidance, and a conclusion with suggested adventure rewards and plot threads that can be further developed. Maps and other reference material are included to help run the adventure. The document is a printer-friendly black and white, for ease of use in print as well as digitally.

A group of kobolds are residing in the city's sewer, and the populace is concerned about their presence. But are they the only thing down there?

boardgame.name: Rise of the Robots
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The city of New Orlando faces an uprising of robots after they become self-aware. They demand full rights and recognition with their newfound sentience, but corporations and city government aren't so willing to lose their captive workforce...

This is a short, system-agnostic adventure for any cyberpunk or science-fiction roleplaying game. It is designed to be played in a single session, or perhaps in a few short sessions. The adventure contains a central plot hook, a series of detailed NPCs featured in the scenario, instructions for setup and establishing the scene, a progression of scenes accompanied by GM guidance, and a conclusion with suggested adventure rewards and plot threads that can be further developed. Maps and other reference material are included to help run the adventure. The document is a printer-friendly black and white, for ease of use in print as well as digitally.

boardgame.name: Yet another 200 Adventure Hooks
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Arranged before you is a list of 200 fantasy plot hooks for prospective GMs to use as hooks for adventures in their roleplaying games. The content contained within covers a range of tones and premises, but remains firmly within the fantasy genre. You are welcome to roll randomly to select a hook for use in your games by dividing the 200 hooks into two separate d100 table, or you can simply choose a prompt that interests you. These seeds are great to improvise a session from, but are also usable as a starting point for developing a longer campaign or story arc. Whatever your specific needs, this product is designed to help give you something to work with when creating adventures for your fantasy roleplaying games.

boardgame.name: Battletech: Technical Readout – 3145 Mercenaries
boardgame.description:
Technical Readout: 3145 Mercenaries introduces the wave of new battle armor, vehicle, BattleMech, and aerospace units appearing across the Inner Sphere in the Dark Age era. Featuring new and matured technology, and presented in this series of faction-specific PDFs, these combat units will add excitement and variety to any game table.

Each title includes Record Sheets for each featured unit and its variants.
